CEE8814.name: Special Topics
CEE8814.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

CEE8815.subject: CEE
CEE8815.name: Special Topics
CEE8815.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

CEE8824.subject: CEE
CEE8824.name: Special Topics
CEE8824.description: Topics of current interest in civil engineering.

CEE8950.subject: CEE
CEE8950.name: Master's Research Proj
CEE8950.description: Master's research project to be scheduled by M.S. students not writing thesis.

CEE8997.subject: CEE
CEE8997.name: Teaching Assistantship
CEE8997.description: For students holding graduate teaching assistantships.

CEE8998.subject: CEE
CEE8998.name: Research Assistantship
CEE8998.description: For students holding a graduate research assistantship.

CEE8999.subject: CEE
CEE8999.name: Prep-Doctor Dissertation
CEE8999.description: For students in the preliminary stages of formulating their doctoral research program who have not obtained formal approval of dissertation topic.

CETL2000.subject: CETL
CETL2000.name: Undergraduate TA Prep
CETL2000.description: This course is an introduction to the procedural information and practical skills needed to be an effective undergraduate teaching assistant. May be used as free elective credit with department approval.

CETL2001.subject: CETL
CETL2001.name: Fund of Peer Tutoring
CETL2001.description: This course is an introduction to the practical skills needed to be an effective peer tutor at Georgia Tech. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL2002.subject: CETL
CETL2002.name: Fund of K-12 Tutoring
CETL2002.description: This course is an introduction to the practical skills needed to be an effective tutor in the K-12 arena. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL2698.subject: CETL
CETL2698.name: Research Assistantship
CETL2698.description: Credit hours to be arranged. Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL2699.subject: CETL
CETL2699.name: Undergraduate Research
CETL2699.description: Credit hours to be arranged. Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member. May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

CETL3000.subject: CETL
CETL3000.name: Residence Life Seminar
CETL3000.description: This course will provide students with techniques, skills and knowledge necessary to become a successful Residence Life Student Staff member. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL3801.subject: CETL
CETL3801.name: Special Topics
CETL3801.description: Topics of current interest. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL4001.subject: CETL
CETL4001.name: Prin of Learn & Teach I
CETL4001.description: This course focuses on the knowledge and skills necessary for effective classroom instruction and management including: educational psychology, instructional design and delivery techniques. May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

CETL4002.subject: CETL
CETL4002.name: Prin of Learn & Teach II
CETL4002.description: This course focuses on the knowledge and skills necessary for effective classroom instruction and management including instructional planning, assessment, and the teaching professional community. May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

CETL4698.subject: CETL
CETL4698.name: Research Assistantship
CETL4698.description: Credit hours to be arranged. Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL4699.subject: CETL
CETL4699.name: Undergraduate Research
CETL4699.description: May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

CETL4801.subject: CETL
CETL4801.name: Special Topics
CETL4801.description: Topics of Current Interest. May not be used towards degree requirements. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL4802.subject: CETL
CETL4802.name: Special Topics
CETL4802.description: Topics of Current Interest. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL4803.subject: CETL
CETL4803.name: Special Topics
CETL4803.description: Topics of Current Interest. May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL6490.subject: CETL
CETL6490.name: Adv Environ Data Analy
CETL6490.description: A unified view of the theories and applications underlying the statistical analysis of environmental data in the space, time and spectral domain.

CETL8000.subject: CETL
CETL8000.name: GTA Preparation
CETL8000.description: This course is an introduction to the procedural information and practical skills needed to be an effective graduate teaching assistant.

CETL8701.subject: CETL
CETL8701.name: Classroom Management
CETL8701.description: A course in which students learn about official Georgia Tech policies impacting instruction and develop skills to resolve problems and enhance classroom learning.

CETL8711.subject: CETL
CETL8711.name: STEP Summer Training
CETL8711.description: Participants attend training sessions on pedagogy, classroom management, educational technology; engage in practice teaching; and design action plans for partnering with local high school teachers.

CETL8712.subject: CETL
CETL8712.name: STEP Seminar
CETL8712.description: This is the academic year follow-up course for STEP fellows. It is a forum to share and to continue training as the fellows work in their STEP high schools.

CETL8713.subject: CETL
CETL8713.name: Teach&Learn-Higher Edu
CETL8713.description: This course focuses on learner-centered teaching and educational research. Students design lesson plans, practice teaching, self-reflect, give and receive peer feedback, and write a teaching philosophy.

CETL8714.subject: CETL
CETL8714.name: Teach Practicum-HigherEd
CETL8714.description: Apprentice to faculty mentor and help teach a college course. Get feedback from mentor, CETL, and a peer learning community. Explore types of academic careers.

CETL8715.subject: CETL
CETL8715.name: Teach Practicum-HigherEd
CETL8715.description: Apprentice to faculty mentor and help teach a college course. Get feedback from mentor, CETL, and a peer learning community. Explore types of academic careers.

CETL8717.subject: CETL
CETL8717.name: Course Design-Higher Edu
CETL8717.description: Application of learner-centered teaching paradigm and educational research to create a course syllabus and design other course elements for a college-level course of their choosing.

CETL8721.subject: CETL
CETL8721.name: Academic Writing
CETL8721.description: Through examination of writing samples and practice, students learn techniques for enhancing proposal preparation and methods for evaluating writing as future instructors and thesis directors.

CETL8722.subject: CETL
CETL8722.name: Int'l Academic Writing
CETL8722.description: This course aids international graduate students in enhancing their academic writing skills in English through exposure to, and practice of producing examples of academic writing. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8722 and CETL 8723.

CETL8723.subject: CETL
CETL8723.name: Acad Writ Intnl Grads
CETL8723.description: This course helps international graduate students enhance their academic writing skills in English through analysis and production of academic writing samples. Credit not awarded for both CETL 8723 and CETL 8722.

CETL8731.subject: CETL
CETL8731.name: Academic Professional
CETL8731.description: Participants in this course work through numerous exercises and scenarios in order to prepare them professionally and personally for a future career in academics.

CETL8741.subject: CETL
CETL8741.name: Academic Presentations
CETL8741.description: An examination and practice of oral presentations in a variety of academic scenarios: e.g., conference talks, proposal presentations, discussion facilitation, job talks, and oral exams/defenses.

CETL8791.subject: CETL
CETL8791.name: Instruc Practice-Intl TA
CETL8791.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation and instructional skills for international teaching assistants. In-class and small-group language practice; discussion of teaching methodology.

CETL8792.subject: CETL
CETL8792.name: Engl/Pedegogy-Intl TAs
CETL8792.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation and instructional skills for international teaching assistants. In-class and small-group language practice; discussion of teaching methodology; individual tutoring.

CETL8793.subject: CETL
CETL8793.name: English for Intl Grads
CETL8793.description: An oral skills class designed to help graduate students become more accurate and fluent in both verbal and nonverbal skills. In addition to working on acquiring an American accent and body language when speaking English, students will work on basic presentation skills. Credit will not be awarded for CETL 8793 and CETL 8797.

CETL8794.subject: CETL
CETL8794.name: Academic English
CETL8794.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation for international teaching assistants. In-class and small group language practice.

CETL8795.subject: CETL
CETL8795.name: Adv English - Int'l Grads
CETL8795.description: An advanced oral skills class designed to help graduate students improve their verbal ability in English for teaching, making presentations, and interacting in academic and professional situations. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8796 and CETL 8795.

CETL8796.subject: CETL
CETL8796.name: Pres Skills Intl Grads
CETL8796.description: This advanced oral skills class is designed to help graduate students improve their presentation skills in English for more effective communication in academic/professinal situations. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8795 and CETL 8796.

CETL8797.subject: CETL
CETL8797.name: Oral Comm Intl Grads
CETL8797.description: In this class, students work on fluency, pronunciation clarity, and appropriateness in spoken communication to prepare for effective and confident participation in their academic communities. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8797 and CETL 8793.

CETL8997.subject: CETL
CETL8997.name: STEP Assistantship
CETL8997.description: This course if for STEP students with an assistantship.

CHBE1750.subject: CHBE
CHBE1750.name: Intro to Bioengineering
CHBE1750.description: An introduction to the field of bioengineering, including the application of engineering principles and methods to problems in biology and medicine, the integration of engineering with biology, and the emerging industrial opportunities. Crosslisted with AE, BMED, ECE, ME, and MSE 1750.

CHBE2100.subject: CHBE
CHBE2100.name: Chem Process Principles
CHBE2100.description: Material and energy balances for single-phase and multi-phase processes common to chemical engineering. Phase equilibrium and analysis of reacting systems.

CHBE2110.subject: CHBE
CHBE2110.name: Chem Engr. Thermo I
CHBE2110.description: Elements of engineering thermodynamics. First and second laws. Analysis of engineering machinery: compressors, turbines, engines, refrigeration. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 2110 and CHBE 2130.

CHBE2120.subject: CHBE
CHBE2120.name: ChE Numerical Mthods
CHBE2120.description: Numerical methods are introduced and applied to the solution of chemical engineering problems. An introduction to chemical process simulation, and the appropriate software is provided.

CHBE2130.subject: CHBE
CHBE2130.name: Chem Eng Thermo I
CHBE2130.description: Basic principles of chemical engineering thermodynamics including first and second laws, equations of state, PVT properties, power cycles and refrigeration. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 2130 and CHBE 2110.

CHBE2698.subject: CHBE
CHBE2698.name: Research Assistantship
CHBE2698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE2699.subject: CHBE
CHBE2699.name: Undergraduate Research
CHBE2699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE2801.subject: CHBE
CHBE2801.name: Special Topics
CHBE2801.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE2803.subject: CHBE
CHBE2803.name: Special Topics
CHBE2803.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE3110.subject: CHBE
CHBE3110.name: Chem Engr. Thermo II
CHBE3110.description: Phase and chemical reaction equilibria. Vapor-liquid, liquid-liquid, and solid-vapor phase equilibrium Fugacity and activity coefficients. Multi-reaction equilibrium. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 3110 and CHBE 3130.

CHBE3130.subject: CHBE
CHBE3130.name: Chem Eng Thermo II
CHBE3130.description: Basic principles of chemical engineering solution and phase equilibrium thermodynamics, including ideal and non-ideal solution models and phase equilibira calculations (VLE, SLE, LLE). Credit not allowed for both CHBE 3130 and CHBE 3110.

CHBE3200.subject: CHBE
CHBE3200.name: Transport Processes I
CHBE3200.description: Fundamentals of fluid mechanics and heat transfer. The design and analysis of equipment using the principles of fluid mechanics and heat transfer.

CHBE3210.subject: CHBE
CHBE3210.name: Transport Processes II
CHBE3210.description: Fundamental principles and applications of mass transfer. The analysis of chemical engineering processes and operations involving mass transfer.

CHBE3225.subject: CHBE
CHBE3225.name: Separations Processes
CHBE3225.description: Fundamentals of equilibrium-stage and continuous contacting operations. Applications of principles to distillation, absorption/stripping, extraction, absorption, and other separation technologies.

CHBE3600.subject: CHBE
CHBE3600.name: Engineering Ethics
CHBE3600.description: Development of quantitative and qualitative assessment tools to resolve moral and ethical dilemmas that arise in the performance of engineering duties.

CHBE4020.subject: CHBE
CHBE4020.name: Chem Eng-Nanoscale Sys
CHBE4020.description: Application of chemical processing fundamentals, fabrication, and characterization to design and analyze technologically important nanoscale systems. The course emphasizes an integrated engineering and science approach.

CHBE4050.subject: CHBE
CHBE4050.name: Microelec Fabrication
CHBE4050.description: An elective class for students interested in fabrication of semiconductor devices focusing on the fundamentals of materials synthesis, chemical and mechanical properties, and chemical reactions. Credit will not be awarded for both CHBE 4050 and CHBE 6050.

CHBE4200.subject: CHBE
CHBE4200.name: Unit Operations Lab
CHBE4200.description: This course illustrates engineering/scientific principles and physical models important to the data collection/ interpretation of processes important to the practice of chemical engineering.

CHBE4210.subject: CHBE
CHBE4210.name: Bioprocess Unit Ops
CHBE4210.description: This course illustrates engineering/scientific principles and physical models important to the data collection/interpretation of processes important in biotechnology.

CHBE4300.subject: CHBE
CHBE4300.name: Kinetics&Reactor Dsgn
CHBE4300.description: Reacting systems are analyzed in terms of reaction mechanisms, kinetics, and reactor design. Both homogeneous and heterogeneous reactions are considered.

CHBE4310.subject: CHBE
CHBE4310.name: Bioprocess Engineering
CHBE4310.description: Integrating several ChBE core concepts, bioprocess engineering applies the material to biological systems. Items covered are enzyme kinetics, fermentation, downstream processing, and integrated bioprocesses important to the biotech industries.

CHBE4400.subject: CHBE
CHBE4400.name: Chemical Process Control
CHBE4400.description: Dynamics of chemical processes and their control. Techniques of conventional process control as well as digital control. Laboratory experiments to illustrate these concepts.

CHBE4411.subject: CHBE
CHBE4411.name: Process Control
CHBE4411.description: Dynamics of chemical processes and their control. Techniques of conventional process control as well as digital control.

CHBE4412.subject: CHBE
CHBE4412.name: Process Control Lab
CHBE4412.description: Dynamics of chemical processes and their control. Techniques of conventional process control as well as digital control. Laboratory experiments would illustrate these concepts.

CHBE4505.subject: CHBE
CHBE4505.name: Process Design&Economics
CHBE4505.description: Principles of flowsheet synthesis and economic analysis and optimization. A complete design on a chemical process will be undertaken, including concepts of unit operations, design, economics, and safety. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 4505 and CHBE 4530 (or CHBE 4520).

CHBE4510.subject: CHBE
CHBE4510.name: Proc& Prod Design& Econ
CHBE4510.description: Basic principles of chemical process and product design including heuristic design approaches, heat exchanger network design, optimization, and economic evaluation. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 4510 and CHBE 4505 (or CHBE 4525).

CHBE4515.subject: CHBE
CHBE4515.name: Chemical Process Safety
CHBE4515.description: Fundamental sources of chemical hazards and degree of risk. Process design and hazard avoidance are used to reduce risk.

CHBE4520.subject: CHBE
CHBE4520.name: Capstone CHBE Design
CHBE4520.description: Basic principles of chemical process and product design including heuristic design approaches heat exchanger network design, optimization, and economic evaluation. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 4520 and CHBE 4505 (or CHBE 4525).

CHBE4525.subject: CHBE
CHBE4525.name: Bioprocess Design & Econ
CHBE4525.description: Principles of flowsheet synthesis and economic analysis and optimization. A complete design of a biochemical process will be undertaken, including concepts of unit operations, design, economics, and safety. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 4525 and CHBE 4530 (or CHBE 4520).

CHBE4530.subject: CHBE
CHBE4530.name: Capstone ChBE Bio-Design
CHBE4530.description: Basic principles of chemical process and product design including heuristic design approaches, heat exchanger network design, optimization, and economic evaluation. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 4530 and CHBE 4505 (or 4525).

CHBE4535.subject: CHBE
CHBE4535.name: Chemical Product Design
CHBE4535.description: Chemical engineering principles applied to the design of products.

CHBE4573.subject: CHBE
CHBE4573.name: Pulping & Bleaching Lab
CHBE4573.description: Experiments of pulping, bleaching, fiber, and chemical testing are performed. Hands-on experience from chip preparation, cooking, pulp processing, and bleaching are provided.

CHBE4574.subject: CHBE
CHBE4574.name: Papermaking&Pulp Lab
CHBE4574.description: Experiments of pulp preparation, refining, paperforming, handsheet testing, deinking, and recycled pulp processing are performed. Small paper machine operation will be taught.

CHBE4600.subject: CHBE
CHBE4600.name: Engineer Communication
CHBE4600.description: How engineers communicate with engineering and non-engineering professionals. Industry speakers from different fields. Engineering case study. Weekly written and/or oral presentations.

CHBE4698.subject: CHBE
CHBE4698.name: Research Assistantship
CHBE4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE4699.subject: CHBE
CHBE4699.name: Undergraduate Research
CHBE4699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE4752.subject: CHBE
CHBE4752.name: IC Fabrication
CHBE4752.description: The objective of this course is to give students exposure to the various steps involved in the fabrication of integrated circuits and devices. This course will include a laboratory segment in which students fabricate MOS transistors, diffused resistors, and MOS capacitors from a bare silicon substrate. Crosslisted with ECE 4752.

CHBE4755.subject: CHBE
CHBE4755.name: Packaging Substrate Fab
CHBE4755.description: This course provides hands-on instruction in basic packaging substrate fabrication techniques, including interconnect design and testing, dielectric deposition, via formation, and metallization. Crosslisted with ECE 4755.

CHBE4757.subject: CHBE
CHBE4757.name: Biofluid Mechanics
CHBE4757.description: Introduction to the study of blood flow in the cardiovascular system. Emphasis on modeling and the potential of flow studies for clinical research application. Crosslisted with AE and ME 4757.

CHBE4758.subject: CHBE
CHBE4758.name: Biosolid Mechanics
CHBE4758.description: The mechanics of living tissue, e.g., arteries, skin, heart muscle, ligament, tendon, cartilage, and bone. Constitutive equations and some simple mechanical models. Mechanics of cells. Applications. Crosslisted with AE and ME 4758.

CHBE4760.subject: CHBE
CHBE4760.name: Biocatalysis
CHBE4760.description: This course provides an in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts, their functioning in metabolic networks, their application in various industries, recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHEM 4760.

CHBE4763.subject: CHBE
CHBE4763.name: Pulping & Chem Recovery
CHBE4763.description: Pulping and chemical recovery processes are studied on the reaction, delignification, energy, and liquor reuse. The process optimization, air and water pollution minimization are taught. Crosslisted with ME 4763.

CHBE4764.subject: CHBE
CHBE4764.name: Bleaching & Papermaking
CHBE4764.description: Pulp bleaching and formation of paper/board products are studied along with testing, end uses, chemical and mechanical treatment of pulp, non-wood and recycled fiber utilization. Crosslisted with ME 4764.

CHBE4765.subject: CHBE
CHBE4765.name: Drug Design,Devlpmnt&Delivery
CHBE4765.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process, including design of new drugs, synthesis and manufacturing issues, and methods for delivery into the body. Includes student presentations. Crosslisted with CHEM and BMED 4765.

CHBE4770.subject: CHBE
CHBE4770.name: Nuclear Chemical Engr
CHBE4770.description: This course surveys the chemical engineering aspects of nuclear power. Topics include nuclear reactions, fuel cycles, solvent extraction of metals, the properties of actinides and other irradiated fuel materials, fuel reprocessing, and radioactive waste management. Crosslisted with NRE 4770.

CHBE4775.subject: CHBE
CHBE4775.name: Polymer Science & Engr I
CHBE4775.description: An introduction to the chemistry, structure, and formation of polymers, physical states and transitions, physical and mechanical properties to polymer fluids and solids. Crosslisted with CHEM, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4775.

CHBE4776.subject: CHBE
CHBE4776.name: Polymer Science& Engr II
CHBE4776.description: Polymer fabrication processes and methods of characterization and identification of polymers are presented. Experiments in polymerization, processing and property evaluation of polymers. Crosslisted with CHEM, ME, MSE, and TFE 4776.

CHBE4781.subject: CHBE
CHBE4781.name: Biomed Instrumentation
CHBE4781.description: A study of medical instrumentation from a systems viewpoint. Pertinent physiological and electro-physiological concepts will be covered. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 4781 and (CHE 4781 or ECE 4781 or BMED 4781 or ME 4781).

CHBE4782.subject: CHBE
CHBE4782.name: Biosystems Analysis
CHBE4782.description: Analytical methods for modeling biological systems, including white-noise protocols for characterizing nonlinear systems. Crosslisted with BMED, ECE and ME 4782.

CHBE4791.subject: CHBE
CHBE4791.name: Mech Behavior-Composites
CHBE4791.description: Stress-strain behavior of composites, property of matrix and reinforcing materials, mechanics of fiber-reinforced composites, lamina and laminate analysis, and mechanical performance. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4791.

CHBE4793.subject: CHBE
CHBE4793.name: Composite Mater& Process
CHBE4793.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4793.

CHBE4794.subject: CHBE
CHBE4794.name: Composite Materials& Mfg
CHBE4794.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4794.

CHBE4801.subject: CHBE
CHBE4801.name: Spec Topic-Chemical Engr
CHBE4801.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4802.subject: CHBE
CHBE4802.name: Spec Topic-Chemical Engr
CHBE4802.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4803.subject: CHBE
CHBE4803.name: Spec Topic-Chemical Engr
CHBE4803.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4804.subject: CHBE
CHBE4804.name: Spec Topic-Chemical Engr
CHBE4804.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4805.subject: CHBE
CHBE4805.name: Spec Topic-Chemical Engr
CHBE4805.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4806.subject: CHBE
CHBE4806.name: Spec Topic-Chemical Engr
CHBE4806.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4853.subject: CHBE
CHBE4853.name: Special Topics
CHBE4853.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE4901.subject: CHBE
CHBE4901.name: Spec Probs-Chemical Engr
CHBE4901.description: The student is given an opportunity to develop initiative and to apply fundamental principles by doing semioriginal laboratory or theoretical investigation of a chemical engineering problem.

CHBE4902.subject: CHBE
CHBE4902.name: Spec Probs-Chemical Engr
CHBE4902.description: The student is given an opportunity to develop initiative and to apply fundamental principles by doing semioriginal laboratory or theoretical investigation of a chemical engineering problem.

CHBE4903.subject: CHBE
CHBE4903.name: Spec Probs-Chemical Engr
CHBE4903.description: The student is given an opportunity to develop initiative and to apply fundamental principles by doing semioriginal laboratory or theoretical investigation of a chemical engineering problem.

CHBE6001.subject: CHBE
CHBE6001.name: Introduction to Research
CHBE6001.description: This course introduces ChBE graduate students to topics that will be encountered in research and fulfills RCR (responsible conduct of reseach) in-person training requirements.

CHBE6003.subject: CHBE
CHBE6003.name: Chem Process Safety
CHBE6003.description: The course focuses on risk reduction through design and hazard avoidance. Sources of chemical hazards and risks are discussed.

CHBE6004.subject: CHBE
CHBE6004.name: Communication Skills
CHBE6004.description: Applications of both written and oral communication skills to the solution of technical problems. Includes focus, audience analysis, visual aids, and organization.

CHBE6020.subject: CHBE
CHBE6020.name: Chem Eng in Nanosystems
CHBE6020.description: Application of chemical processing fundamentals, fabrication, and characterization to design and analyze technologically important nanoscale systems. The course emphasizes an integrated engineering and science approach.

CHBE6050.subject: CHBE
CHBE6050.name: Microelec Fabrication
CHBE6050.description: An elective class for students interested in fabrication of semiconductor devices focusing on the fundamentals of materials synthesis, chemical and mechanical properties, and chemical reactions. Credit will not be awarded for both CHBE 6050 and CHBE 4050.

CHBE6100.subject: CHBE
CHBE6100.name: Adv CHE Thermodynamics
CHBE6100.description: Equations of state, corresponding states, and activity coefficient models and their relationship to intermolecular forces. Phase and chemical equilibria in chemical engineering.

CHBE6110.subject: CHBE
CHBE6110.name: Thermo-Large Molecules
CHBE6110.description: Classical and statistical thermodynamics of systems that are important in chemical, biochemical, and polymer processing.

CHBE6120.subject: CHBE
CHBE6120.name: Molecular Modeling
CHBE6120.description: Introduction to computational chemistry techniques for modeling substances at the molecular level, including: ab initio and semiempirical quantum methods, molecular dynamics, and Monte Carlo methods.

CHBE6130.subject: CHBE
CHBE6130.name: Electrochemical Engr
CHBE6130.description: Electrochemical thermodynamics and kinetics. Corrosion. Applications to semiconductor devices, fuel cells, and batteries.

CHBE6200.subject: CHBE
CHBE6200.name: Transport Phenomena
CHBE6200.description: Transfer Viscous fluid mechanics and convective heat transfer. Scaling analysis and lubrication. Stokes, and boundary layer flows. Transport about solid bodies. Linear stability theory.

CHBE6210.subject: CHBE
CHBE6210.name: Fluid Mech Two-Phse Flow
CHBE6210.description: Two-phase flow of nondeformable particles in Newtonian fluids. Rigorous results in the limit of small Reynolds number motions and applications to suspensions and colloids.

CHBE6220.subject: CHBE
CHBE6220.name: Computational Fluid Dyn
CHBE6220.description: Applications in Environmental and Chemical Processes. Introduction to numerical methods for solving transport problems. Applications to problems of interest in environmental and chemical processes.

CHBE6229.subject: CHBE
CHBE6229.name: Intro to MEMS
CHBE6229.description: Introduction to Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems: Microfabrication techniques including: photolithography, etching, physical and chemical vapor deposition, electroplating, bonding and polymer processing. Application to sensors and actuators.

CHBE6230.subject: CHBE
CHBE6230.name: Industrial Emission Ctrl
CHBE6230.description: Analysis of air quality criteria, ambient and emission standards, and industrial pollution sources. Recovery and utilization of waste gases and particulate matter.

CHBE6231.subject: CHBE
CHBE6231.name: Env Modeling-Forest Ind
CHBE6231.description: The science and engineering of waste treatment processes in the pulp and paper industry.

CHBE6232.subject: CHBE
CHBE6232.name: ChemE Process Pulp Paper
CHBE6232.description: To study the details of some of the major unit operations in pulp and paper manufacturing.

CHBE6240.subject: CHBE
CHBE6240.name: Separation Processes
CHBE6240.description: This course provides an advanced analysis of separation process technology, with special emphasis on new separation techniques and their applications.

CHBE6250.subject: CHBE
CHBE6250.name: Mass Transport
CHBE6250.description: An in-depth introduction to transport of penetrants in and through solids. Convective flow through porous media, and conductive flow through homogenous solids. Membrane separations.

CHBE6260.subject: CHBE
CHBE6260.name: Mass Transfer
CHBE6260.description: Mass transport processes and material properties that affect them. Principles of both steady- and unsteady-state molecular diffusion are developed and transfer mechanisms examined.

CHBE6300.subject: CHBE
CHBE6300.name: Kinetics & Reactor Dsgn
CHBE6300.description: A study of chemical kinetics and mechanisms in complex homogeneous and heterogeneous reaction systems. Design and analysis of chemical reactors for such systems.

CHBE6310.subject: CHBE
CHBE6310.name: Chemical Kinetics
CHBE6310.description: Applications of chemical kinetics to homogeneous and heterogeneous gas and liquid reactions, including techniques and analyses.

CHBE6320.subject: CHBE
CHBE6320.name: Heterogeneous Catalysis
CHBE6320.description: Physics and chemistry of surfaces; thermodynamics, kinetics, and mechanism of adsorption and surface reactions; modern instrumental analyses; and industrial catalysis.

CHBE6400.subject: CHBE
CHBE6400.name: Adv Process Control
CHBE6400.description: Fundamentals of multivariate control theory as applied to chemical processes.

CHBE6410.subject: CHBE
CHBE6410.name: Dyn Behavior-Process Sys
CHBE6410.description: Introduction to process dynamics. Modeling of lumped systems with and without chemical reactions. Lumped processes involving phase equilibrium. Distributed parameter systems. Optimization of transient processes.

CHBE6460.subject: CHBE
CHBE6460.name: MEMS Devices
CHBE6460.description: Introduces fundamental concepts and tools needed for the design, simulation and analysis of MEMS devices. These include electrical, mechanical, radiant, thermal, magnetic and chemical domains. Credit not allowed for both CHBE 6460 and ME 6460 or ECE 6460.

CHBE6500.subject: CHBE
CHBE6500.name: Math Model-Chem Process
CHBE6500.description: Formulation and solution of mathematical models of a range of chemical processes with an emphasis on differential balances and incorporation of uncertainty.

CHBE6600.subject: CHBE
CHBE6600.name: Polymer Reaction Engr
CHBE6600.description: Polymerization processes are analyzed with regard to reaction mechanism, kinetics, and reactor design. Control of polymer structure during polymerization is emphasized.

CHBE6608.subject: CHBE
CHBE6608.name: Microlithography
CHBE6608.description: The study of fundamental issues from physics, chemistry, chemical engineering, and electrical engineering inherent in semiconductor microlithography, encompassing both materials and processes used for pattern definition.

CHBE6609.subject: CHBE
CHBE6609.name: Polym-Micorelectronics
CHBE6609.description: Use of polymers in microelectronics applications such as photolithography, interlevel dielectrics, encapsulation, packaging, magnetic media, and optical storage.

CHBE6634.subject: CHBE
CHBE6634.name: Wet End Processing-Paper
CHBE6634.description: Wet end colloidal and polymer science of papermaking processes. Processing with fiber, mineral fillers, brighteners, and polymer additives.

CHBE6701.subject: CHBE
CHBE6701.name: Found Forest Bioproducts
CHBE6701.description: The course provides comprehensive foundational knowledge of the industry enabling the student to understand the role of diverse manufacturing operations and to strategically plan improvements. Course is cross-listed with MLDR 6701, CHBE 6741, ME 6741, CHEM 6741, MSE 6741, CHBE 6742, ME 6742, CHEM 6742, MSE 6742.

CHBE6710.subject: CHBE
CHBE6710.name: Microfluidics & Appl
CHBE6710.description: This course explores the fundamentals of microfluidics and nanofluidics, and their applications, primarily in biological and medical sciences (e.g. biomolecular separations). Credit not allowed for both CHBE 6710 and CHBE 4710.

CHBE6741.subject: CHBE
CHBE6741.name: Pulp & Paper Mfg I
CHBE6741.description: The fundamentals of pulp and paper technology are presented. Applications to the several unit operations used are explored and augmented by field trips and recent case studies. Crosslisted with ME 6741, CHBE 6701 and MLDR 6701.

CHBE6742.subject: CHBE
CHBE6742.name: Pulp & Paper Mfg II
CHBE6742.description: Papermaking technology is covered from a multidisciplinary engineering perspective with fundamental and practical considerations being addressed. Students participate in groups to run a pilot papermaking trial at the Henry Foundation in Savannah. Crosslisted with ME 6741, CHBE 6701 and MLDR 6701.

CHBE6750.subject: CHBE
CHBE6750.name: Prep&Reactions-Polymers
CHBE6750.description: A detailed treatment of the reactions involved in the synthesis of both human-made and natural polymers, including preparation and degradative reactions of polymer systems. Crosslisted with CHEM and PTFE 6750

CHBE6751.subject: CHBE
CHBE6751.name: Phys Chem-Poly Solutions
CHBE6751.description: Study of polymer solutions, polymer miscibility, adsorption, sorption, plasticization, molecular weights, molecular weight distributions, and interfacial phenomena using thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Crosslisted with CHEM, MSE, and PTFE 6751.

CHBE6752.subject: CHBE
CHBE6752.name: Polymer Characterization
CHBE6752.description: This course introduces the student to surface, near-surface and structural methods of polymer characterization. Specialized techniques critical to physical structure are emphasized. Crosslisted with CHEM, MSE, and PTFE 6752.

CHBE6759.subject: CHBE
CHBE6759.name: Plasma Processing
CHBE6759.description: Fundamental physics, chemistry, chemical engineering, and electrical engineering principles inherent in plasma processes. Includes etching, deposition, diagnostic methods, and control schemes. Crosslisted with ECE 6759.

CHBE6760.subject: CHBE
CHBE6760.name: Biocatalysis
CHBE6760.description: This course provides in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts, their functioning in metabolic networks, their application in various industries, and recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHEM 6760.

CHBE6765.subject: CHBE
CHBE6765.name: Drug Design,Devlpmnt&Delivery
CHBE6765.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process, including design of new drugs, synthesis and manufacturing issues, and methods of delivery into the body. Includes student presentations. Crosslisted with BMED 6765 and CHBE 6765.

CHBE6768.subject: CHBE
CHBE6768.name: Polymer Structure& Props
CHBE6768.description: Formulations and analysis of molecular and phenomenological models of elastic and viscoelastic behavior, development and description of structure, and fundamental aspects of structure-property relations. Crosslisted with ME, PTFE, and MSE 6768.

CHBE6774.subject: CHBE
CHBE6774.name: Biomaterial:Struct&Funct
CHBE6774.description: Structure-function relationships of biomaterials and biomaterial characterization will be covered. Materials for medical implants, tissue engineering, biosensing, imaging, and drug delivery will be covered. Crosslisted with BMED, ME, and MSE 6774.

CHBE6777.subject: CHBE
CHBE6777.name: Advanced Biomaterials
CHBE6777.description: Advanced topics of biomaterials performance and engineering, including biointerfaces, host reactions of materials, and bio-inspired/smart-materials strategies. Crosslisted with BMED, ME, and MSE 6777.

CHBE6778.subject: CHBE
CHBE6778.name: Intro to Biomaterials
CHBE6778.description: Introduction to a variety of biomaterials and their biomedical applications. Crosslisted with BMED and PTFE 6778.

CHBE6779.subject: CHBE
CHBE6779.name: Bioprocess Engineering
CHBE6779.description: Study of enzymes and microbial and mammalian cells for production of biochemicals and protein therapeutics in bioreactors; downstream separation and purification; integrated view of bioprocesses. Crosslisted with BMED 6779.

CHBE6782.subject: CHBE
CHBE6782.name: Cellular Engineering
CHBE6782.description: Engineering analysis of cellular systems. Crosslisted with BMED and ME 6782.

CHBE6784.subject: CHBE
CHBE6784.name: Cardiovascular Biomech
CHBE6784.description: Mechanical analysis of the cardiovascular system emphasizing the normal and pathologic function in relation to clinical cardiovascular medicine. Crosslisted with BMED and ME 6784.

CHBE6789.subject: CHBE
CHBE6789.name: Technology Ventures
CHBE6789.description: Team discussion and case studies in biomedical engineering technology transfer, including licensing, financial capital, safety and efficacy studies, clinical trials, and strategic planning. Crosslisted with BMED, ECE, ME, and MGT 6789.

CHBE6793.subject: CHBE
CHBE6793.name: Systems Pathophysiology
CHBE6793.description: Overview of human pathophysiology from a quantitative perspective. A brief introduction to the application of quantitative models to the understanding of biological systems. Crosslisted with BMED, ECE, and ME 6793.

CHBE6794.subject: CHBE
CHBE6794.name: Tissue Engineering
CHBE6794.description: Biological, engineering, and medical issues in developing tissue-engineered constructs. Emphasis on the integration of these disciplines at a basic molecular and cell biology level. Crosslisted with CHE and ME 6794.

CHBE6799.subject: CHBE
CHBE6799.name: Legal Issues-Tech Transf
CHBE6799.description: Study and analysis of U.S. law as it applies to the patenting and licensing processes. Crosslisted with BMED, ME, and MGT 6799.

CHBE7650.subject: CHBE
CHBE7650.name: Chemistry of Polymers
CHBE7650.description: Thermodynamics and microscopic dynamics of polymers. Fundamental concepts, including scaling concepts, governing anisotropy of polarizability, phase transitions, morphology, time-dependent correlations, etc.

CHBE7757.subject: CHBE
CHBE7757.name: Teaching Practicum
CHBE7757.description: Supervised teaching for doctoral students. Teaching techniques, course and curriculum design, student evaluation methods and criteria. Students may, in some instances, prepare and present lectures. Crosslisted with NRE, ME, HP 7757.

CHBE7771.subject: CHBE
CHBE7771.name: Mech-Polymer Solid&Fluid
CHBE7771.description: Continuum mechanics of solids and fluids; mechanics of deformation of anisotropic polymers; yield, breaking, and fatigue; non-Newtonian viscous and viscoelastic behavior of polymer fluids. Crosslisted with ME, MSE, and PTFE 7771.

CHBE7772.subject: CHBE
CHBE7772.name: Fund-Fracture Mechanics
CHBE7772.description: Advanced study of failure of structural materials under load, mechanics of fracture, and microscopic and macroscopic aspects of the fracture of engineering materials. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, and MSE 7772.

CHBE7773.subject: CHBE
CHBE7773.name: Adv Fracture Mechanics
CHBE7773.description: Nonlinear fracture mechanics including elastic-plastic and time-dependent fracture, advanced test methods, J-integral theory, and extensions. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, and MSE 7773.

CHBE7774.subject: CHBE
CHBE7774.name: Fatigue-Materials&Struct
CHBE7774.description: Mechanical and microstructural aspects of nucleation and growth of cracks under cyclic loading conditions, notch effects, cumulative damage, multiaxial loading, and fatigue crack propagation. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, and MSE 7774.

CHBE7775.subject: CHBE
CHBE7775.name: Fract&Fatigue-Structures
CHBE7775.description: Structures Brittle and ductile failure criteria. Failure prediction in composite structures. Free-edge and internal delamination. Anisotropic cracks. Fatigue behavior of composites and comparison with metal fatigue. Crosslisted with AE, ME, and MSE 7775.

CHBE7791.subject: CHBE
CHBE7791.name: Damage & Fail-Composites
CHBE7791.description: Provides knowledge of the fundamental concepts and methods related to analysis and assessment of damage, failure, and durability of composite materials. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 7791.

CHBE7792.subject: CHBE
CHBE7792.name: Mechanics of Composites
CHBE7792.description: Anisotropic elasticity, failure theories, hydrothermal behavior, 3-D analysis of laminates, thick laminates, free- edge effects, stress concentrations, joints, creep, and fracture of composites, and advanced topics. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 7792.

CHBE7793.subject: CHBE
CHBE7793.name: Manufacture-Composites
CHBE7793.description: Major manufacturing techniques for metal, ceramic, and polymer matrix composites. Modeling of processes with emphasis on fundamental mechanisms and effects. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 7793.

CHBE8997.subject: CHBE
CHBE8997.name: Teaching Assistantship
CHBE8997.description: For graduate students holding teaching assistantships.

CHBE8998.subject: CHBE
CHBE8998.name: Research Assistantship
CHBE8998.description: For graduate students holding research assistantships.

CHEM1211K.subject: CHEM
CHEM1211K.name: Chemical Principles I
CHEM1211K.description: Topics to be covered include atomic structure, bonding, properties of matter, thermodynamics and physical equilibria. Laboratory exercises supplement the lecture material. Credit not allowed for both CHEM 1310 and CHEM 1211K.

CHEM1212K.subject: CHEM
CHEM1212K.name: Chemical Principles II
CHEM1212K.description: Topics to be covered include chemical equilibria, acids and bases, aqueous equilibria, electrochemistry, kinetics, main group and transition elements. Laboratory exercises supplement the lecture material. Credit not allowed for CHEM 1311/1312 and CHEM 1212K.

CHEM1310.subject: CHEM
CHEM1310.name: General Chemistry
CHEM1310.description: Fundamental laws and theories of chemical reactions. Topics include atomic structure; bonding theory; stoichiometry; properties of solids, liquids and gases; chemical thermodynamics; electrochemistry; and kinetics. Credit not allowed for both CHEM 1211K and CHEM 1310.

CHEM1315.subject: CHEM
CHEM1315.name: Survey of Organic Chem
CHEM1315.description: Survey of organic chemistry as the basis for biochemical processes and commercial applications.

CHEM2211.subject: CHEM
CHEM2211.name: Quantitative Analysis
CHEM2211.description: Laboratory experimentation emphasizing quantitative chemical analysis. Credit not allowed for both CHEM 2211 and CHEM 1313.

CHEM2311.subject: CHEM
CHEM2311.name: Organic Chemistry I
CHEM2311.description: An introduction to structure and reactivity of organic molecules.

CHEM2312.subject: CHEM
CHEM2312.name: Organic Chemistry II
CHEM2312.description: The second course in the series dealing with the structure and reactivity of organic molecules.

CHEM2313.subject: CHEM
CHEM2313.name: Organic/Bioorganic Chem
CHEM2313.description: A second course in organic chemistry that extends the study to topics in biochemistry.

CHEM2380.subject: CHEM
CHEM2380.name: Synthesis Lab I
CHEM2380.description: Methods for preparation, isolation, and characterization of complex organic molecules, natural products, and polymers.

CHEM2694.subject: CHEM
CHEM2694.name: Intern Assistantship
CHEM2694.description: Undergraduate Internship for which the student is paid, Freshmen and Sophomores only.

CHEM2695.subject: CHEM
CHEM2695.name: Undergraduate Internship
CHEM2695.description: Undergraduate Internship for academic credit, Freshmen and Sophomores only.

CHEM2698.subject: CHEM
CHEM2698.name: Research Assistantship
CHEM2698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHEM2699.subject: CHEM
CHEM2699.name: Undergraduate Research
CHEM2699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHEM2801.subject: CHEM
CHEM2801.name: Special Topics
CHEM2801.description: Lecture course in current special topics in chemistry and biochemistry. Topics will vary from year to year.

CHEM2802.subject: CHEM
CHEM2802.name: Special Topics
CHEM2802.description: Lecture course in current special topics in chemistry and biochemistry. Topics will vary from year to year.

CHEM2803.subject: CHEM
CHEM2803.name: Special Topics
CHEM2803.description: Lecture course in current special topics in chemistry and biochemistry. Topics will vary from year to year.

CHEM2901.subject: CHEM
CHEM2901.name: Special Prob - Chemistry
CHEM2901.description: Course of individual instruction, which will include library conference and laboratory experience.

CHEM2902.subject: CHEM
CHEM2902.name: Special Prob - Chemistry
CHEM2902.description: Course of individuated instruction, which will include library, conference and laboratory experience.

CHEM2903.subject: CHEM
CHEM2903.name: Special Prob - Chemistry
CHEM2903.description: Course of individuated instruction, which will include library conference and laboratory experience.

CHEM3111.subject: CHEM
CHEM3111.name: Inorganic Chemistry
CHEM3111.description: A study of the reactions and structures of inorganic compounds and principles, generalizations and theories that assist in understanding their behavior.

CHEM3211.subject: CHEM
CHEM3211.name: Analytical Chemistry
CHEM3211.description: Introduction to the theory and practice of modern chemical analysis.

CHEM3281.subject: CHEM
CHEM3281.name: Instrumental Analysis
CHEM3281.description: Provides a background to modern analytical chemistry and instrumental methods of analysis with applications to engineering and other areas.

CHEM3371.subject: CHEM
CHEM3371.name: Organic Chem Lab
CHEM3371.description: Multi-step organic synthesis and inorganic synthesis. Use of chemical literature and advanced spectroscopic techniques.

CHEM3380.subject: CHEM
CHEM3380.name: Synthesis Lab II
CHEM3380.description: Multi-step organic and inorganic synthesis. Use of the chemical literature and advanced spectroscopic techniques.

CHEM3411.subject: CHEM
CHEM3411.name: Physical Chemistry I
CHEM3411.description: Chemical thermodynamics, energetics of chemical reactions, changes of state, and electrochemistry.

CHEM3412.subject: CHEM
CHEM3412.name: Physical Chemistry II
CHEM3412.description: Quantum mechanics, atomic and molecular structure, bonding theory, molecular spectroscopy, statistical mechanics.

CHEM3481.subject: CHEM
CHEM3481.name: Physical Chem Lab I
CHEM3481.description: Laboratory investigations of physical principles applied to chemical systems.

CHEM3482.subject: CHEM
CHEM3482.name: Physical Chem Lab II
CHEM3482.description: Laboratory investigations of physical principles applied to chemical systems.

CHEM3511.subject: CHEM
CHEM3511.name: Survey of Biochemistry
CHEM3511.description: Introductory course in biochemistry dealing with the chemistry and biochemistry of proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and other biomolecules.

CHEM3700.subject: CHEM
CHEM3700.name: Alternative Energy
CHEM3700.description: Scientific principles governing the current and future approaches in solar photo-voltaics, fuel cells, biomass conversion, nuclear energy and wind power.

CHEM4113.subject: CHEM
CHEM4113.name: Inorg Energy Conversion
CHEM4113.description: The principles of coordination chemistry applied to theories and mechanisms of energy conversion and storage in chemistry and biology. Students cannot receive credit for CHEM 4113 and CHEM 6171.

CHEM4311.subject: CHEM
CHEM4311.name: Adv Organic Chem
CHEM4311.description: Construction reactions and functional group interconversions as applied to multistep organic synthesis.

CHEM4341.subject: CHEM
CHEM4341.name: Applied Spectroscopy
CHEM4341.description: Theory and application of NMR, mass spectrometry, and infrared spectroscopy in the determination of organic structures.

CHEM4401.subject: CHEM
CHEM4401.name: Molecular Spectroscopy
CHEM4401.description: Introduction to the theory and applications of molecular spectroscopy, including electronic, vibrational, rotational transitions, and selections rules.

CHEM4452.subject: CHEM
CHEM4452.name: Solid State Chemistry
CHEM4452.description: Application of the concepts of physical and inorganic chemistry to the structure of solids and their chemical and physical properties.

CHEM4511.subject: CHEM
CHEM4511.name: Biochemistry I
CHEM4511.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and other biomolecules.

CHEM4512.subject: CHEM
CHEM4512.name: Biochemistry II
CHEM4512.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and other biomolecules.

CHEM4521.subject: CHEM
CHEM4521.name: Biophysical Chemistry
CHEM4521.description: The physical chemistry of biological systems, biological macromolecules, and biological aggregates.

CHEM4581.subject: CHEM
CHEM4581.name: Biochemistry Lab I
CHEM4581.description: Modern biochemical techniques including methods for protein, nucleic acid, and lipid isolation and characterization; enzyme assays; chromatography; electrophoresis; and use of databases.

CHEM4582.subject: CHEM
CHEM4582.name: Biochemistry Lab II
CHEM4582.description: Laboratory techniques in the isolation and characterization of biological molecules with special emphasis on modern techniques.

CHEM4601.subject: CHEM
CHEM4601.name: Chemistry Seminar
CHEM4601.description: Student presentations of recent research topics in chemistry or biochemistry based on lab experience and/or literature searches.

CHEM4684.subject: CHEM
CHEM4684.name: Advanced Chemistry Lab
CHEM4684.description: A modular laboratory involving a series of multipart experiments that build upon chemical principles and experimental techniques introduced in earlier courses and instructional laboratories. Credit not allowed for both CHEM 4684 and CHEM 4681.

CHEM4694.subject: CHEM
CHEM4694.name: Intern Assistantship
CHEM4694.description: Undergraduate Internship for which the student is paid, Juniors and Seniors only.

CHEM4695.subject: CHEM
CHEM4695.name: Undergraduate Internship
CHEM4695.description: Undergraduate Internship for academic credit, Juniors and Seniors only.

CHEM4698.subject: CHEM
CHEM4698.name: Research Assistantship
CHEM4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHEM4699.subject: CHEM
CHEM4699.name: Undergraduate Research
CHEM4699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHEM4740.subject: CHEM
CHEM4740.name: Atmospheric Chemistry
CHEM4740.description: This course provides a general chemical description of the Earth's atmospheric system with a major focus on the two lowest layers of the atmosphere, i.e., the troposphere and the stratosphere. Crosslisted with EAS 4740.

CHEM4760.subject: CHEM
CHEM4760.name: Biocatalysis
CHEM4760.description: This course provides an in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts, their functioning in metabolic networks, their application in various industries, recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHBE 4760.

CHEM4765.subject: CHEM
CHEM4765.name: Drug Design,Devlpmnt&Delivery
CHEM4765.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process, including design of new drugs, synthesis and manufacturing issues, and methods for delivery into the body. Includes student presentations. Crosslisted with CHBE and BMED 4765.

CHEM4775.subject: CHEM
CHEM4775.name: Polymer Science & Engr I
CHEM4775.description: An introduction to the chemistry, structure, and formation of polymers, physical states and transitions, physical and mechanical properties of polymer fluids and solids. Crosslisted with CHE, ME, MSE, and PTFE 4775.

CHEM4776.subject: CHEM
CHEM4776.name: Polymer Science& Engr II
CHEM4776.description: Polymer fabrication processes and methods of characterization and identification of polymers are presented. Experiments in polymerization, processing, and property evaluation of polymers. Crosslisted with CHE, ME, MSE, and TFE 4776.

CHEM4801.subject: CHEM
CHEM4801.name: Special Topics
CHEM4801.description: Topics of current interest not included in the regular course offerings.

CHEM4802.subject: CHEM
CHEM4802.name: Special Topics
CHEM4802.description: Topics of current interest not included in the regular course offerings.

CHEM4803.subject: CHEM
CHEM4803.name: Special Topics
CHEM4803.description: Topics of current interest not included in the regular course offerings.

CHEM4804.subject: CHEM
CHEM4804.name: Special Topics
CHEM4804.description: Topics of current interest not included in the regular course offerings.

CHEM4901.subject: CHEM
CHEM4901.name: Special Problems in Chem
CHEM4901.description: Course of individualized instruction, which will include library, conference, and laboratory investigations.

CHEM4902.subject: CHEM
CHEM4902.name: Special Problems in Chem
CHEM4902.description: Course of individualized instruction, which will include library, conference, and laboratory investigations.

CHEM4903.subject: CHEM
CHEM4903.name: Special Problems in Chem
CHEM4903.description: Course of individualized instruction, which will include library, conference, and laboratory investigations.

CHEM6170.subject: CHEM
CHEM6170.name: Inorganic Chem I
CHEM6170.description: A series of key topics in inorganic chemistry will be reviewed: acids/bases, redox processes, bonding and structure, transition metal chemistry, coordination complexes.

CHEM6171.subject: CHEM
CHEM6171.name: Inorganic Chem II
CHEM6171.description: Contemporary topics in inorganic chemistry including bioinorganic chemistry, reaction mechanisms and kinetics, optical and magnetic properties of molecular species, and inorganic materials.

CHEM6172.subject: CHEM
CHEM6172.name: Physical Meth-Inorg Chem
CHEM6172.description: An introduction to the use of physical methods in inorganic chemistry including vibrational spectroscopy, multinuclear NMR, EST, Mossbauer, magnetometery, NQR, PES, diffraction, and EXAFS.

CHEM6181.subject: CHEM
CHEM6181.name: Chemical Crystallography
CHEM6181.description: The collection and interpretation of diffraction data. Single crystal structure analysis, powder diffraction for phase identification and quantitative analysis, and Rietveld refinement.

CHEM6182.subject: CHEM
CHEM6182.name: Chem of the Solid State
CHEM6182.description: An introduction to the chemistry of the solid state. Synthetic methods, measurement of properties, structure of solids, theory of electrical, optical, and magnetic properties.

CHEM6183.subject: CHEM
CHEM6183.name: Organometallic Chemistry
CHEM6183.description: The chemistry of main group and transition metal organometallics. Including synthetic methods, homogeneous catalysis and catalytic cycles, and synthetically useful organometallic reagents.

CHEM6271.subject: CHEM
CHEM6271.name: Analytical Chem I
CHEM6271.description: Discussion of chemical equilibrium, separations, and bioanalytical methods.

CHEM6272.subject: CHEM
CHEM6272.name: Analytical Chem II
CHEM6272.description: Topics include experimental design, electronics, and spectroscopy.

CHEM6281.subject: CHEM
CHEM6281.name: Mass Spectrometry
CHEM6281.description: Topics include sample handling, ionization methods, MS/MS, and quantitative analysis.

CHEM6282.subject: CHEM
CHEM6282.name: Chemical Sensors
CHEM6282.description: Origins of selectivity, principles of transduction mechanisms, construction and applications of modern chemical sensors.

CHEM6283.subject: CHEM
CHEM6283.name: Electroanalytical Chem
CHEM6283.description: Coulometry, electrolytic separations, polargraphy chronopotentimetry, coulometric titrations, voltammetry, and hydrodynamic electrochemical methods of analysis.

CHEM6284.subject: CHEM
CHEM6284.name: Environ Analytical Chem
CHEM6284.description: Application of techniques from analytical chemistry in monitoring the environment.

CHEM6285.subject: CHEM
CHEM6285.name: Analytical Spectroscopy
CHEM6285.description: Modern analytical spectroscopy and use of analytical techniques in chemistry and chemical engineering.

CHEM6287.subject: CHEM
CHEM6287.name: Scanned Probe Techniques
CHEM6287.description: An in-depth analysis of the theory, practice and application of scanning probe microscopy techniques.

CHEM6371.subject: CHEM
CHEM6371.name: Organic Compounds
CHEM6371.description: Description of molecular structure and identification of organic compounds using spectroscopic techniques.

CHEM6372.subject: CHEM
CHEM6372.name: Physical Organic Chem
CHEM6372.description: Physical methods in organic chemistry; determination of reaction pathways.

CHEM6373.subject: CHEM
CHEM6373.name: Organic Synthesis
CHEM6373.description: Methods and strategy for the preparation of complex organic compounds.

CHEM6381.subject: CHEM
CHEM6381.name: Adv Organic Synthesis
CHEM6381.description: Advanced topics in the synthesis of complex organic molecules.

CHEM6382.subject: CHEM
CHEM6382.name: Comput Methods-Org Chem
CHEM6382.description: The development of approximate methods in molecular orbital theory and molecular mechanics and their application to problems in organic and biochemistry.

CHEM6471.subject: CHEM
CHEM6471.name: Chem Thermo & Kinetics
CHEM6471.description: Laws of classical thermodynamics and their chemical applications. Introduction to statistical mechanics and chemical kinetics.

CHEM6472.subject: CHEM
CHEM6472.name: Quant Chem & Molec Spec
CHEM6472.description: Introduction to quantum mechanics and its application to molecular systems, atomic and molecular spectroscopy.

CHEM6481.subject: CHEM
CHEM6481.name: Statistical Mechanics
CHEM6481.description: Statistical thermodynamics, lattice statistics, molecular distribution and correlation functions, the theories of liquids and solutions, phase transitions, cluster theory, and measurement.

CHEM6482.subject: CHEM
CHEM6482.name: Kinetics&Reaction Dynam
CHEM6482.description: Modern theoretical and experimental methods for studying macroscopic and microscopic bimolecular and unimolecular processes are discussed, as are methods for describing complex kinetic systems.

CHEM6483.subject: CHEM
CHEM6483.name: Chem-Electronic Material
CHEM6483.description: This course provides a broad description of the basic chemical and physical concepts that determine the properties of electrically active materials.

CHEM6484.subject: CHEM
CHEM6484.name: Chem-Optical Org Mat
CHEM6484.description: Course description includes synthesis, electronic structure, physico-chemical characterization, and device applications of optically active organic materials.

CHEM6485.subject: CHEM
CHEM6485.name: Computational Chemistry
CHEM6485.description: Introductory course in computational chemistry, discussing electronic structure theory, semiemphirical methods, molecular mechanics, transistion-state searching, and computation of thermodynamic quantities.

CHEM6491.subject: CHEM
CHEM6491.name: Quantum Mechanics
CHEM6491.description: Important concepts and applications of quantum mechanics at the intermediate level, including operators, perturbation and variational methods applied to atoms and molecules.

CHEM6492.subject: CHEM
CHEM6492.name: Molecular Spectroscopy
CHEM6492.description: Study of energy of electronic transitions in molecules, selection rules, excitation processes, and laser spectroscopy.

CHEM6501.subject: CHEM
CHEM6501.name: Biochemistry I
CHEM6501.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and other biomolecules.

CHEM6502.subject: CHEM
CHEM6502.name: Biochemistry II
CHEM6502.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and other biomolecules.

CHEM6571.subject: CHEM
CHEM6571.name: Enzymology and Metabolism
CHEM6571.description: Structure and chemistry of enzymes, enzyme mechanism, enzyme kinetics, enzyme inhibitors, and medicinal chemistry.

CHEM6572.subject: CHEM
CHEM6572.name: Macromolecular Structure
CHEM6572.description: Principles of protein, nucleic acid, and membrane structure. Major emphasis on protein folding, detailed description of three-dimensional structure of proteins and nucleic acids.

CHEM6573.subject: CHEM
CHEM6573.name: Molecular Biochemistry
CHEM6573.description: Current topics in molecular biology including eukaryotic transcriptions, RNA processing, repair and recombination, immunity, viruses, DNA fingerprinting, and genome sequencing.

CHEM6581.subject: CHEM
CHEM6581.name: Protein Crystallography
CHEM6581.description: Application of crystallographic principles to the structure determination of macromolecules by molecular replacement, multiple isomorphous replacements. High-speed data collection methods and cryocrystallography.

CHEM6582.subject: CHEM
CHEM6582.name: Biophysical Chemistry
CHEM6582.description: Applications of the principles and techniques of physical chemistry in biochemistry, with emphasis in the equilibrium and dynamic behavior of macromolecules in solution.

CHEM6583.subject: CHEM
CHEM6583.name: Drug Design & Discovery
CHEM6583.description: Application of principles of chemistry and biology to the creation of knowledge leading to the introduction of new therapeutic agents.

CHEM6584.subject: CHEM
CHEM6584.name: Contemporary Biochem
CHEM6584.description: Topics vary from year to year, but will include subjects from the biochemical literature, such as in Journal of Biological Chemistry.

CHEM6750.subject: CHEM
CHEM6750.name: Prep&Reactions-Polymers
CHEM6750.description: A detailed treatment of the reactions involved in the synthesis of both human-made and natural polymers, including preparation and degradative reactions of polymer systems. Crosslisted with CHE and PTFE 6750.

CHEM6751.subject: CHEM
CHEM6751.name: Phys Chem-Poly Solutions
CHEM6751.description: Study of polymer solutions, polymer miscibility, absorptions, sorptions, plasticization, molecular weights, molecular weight distributions, and interfacial phenomena using thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Crosslisted with CHE, MSE, and PTFE 6751.

CHEM6752.subject: CHEM
CHEM6752.name: Polymer Characterization
CHEM6752.description: This course introduces the student to surface, near-surface, and structural methods of polymer characterization. Specialized techniques critical to physical structure are emphasized. Crosslisted with CHE, MSE, and PTFE 6752.

CHEM6755.subject: CHEM
CHEM6755.name: Theoretical Chem-Polymer
CHEM6755.description: Thermodynamics and microscopic dynamics of polymers. Fundamental concepts, including scaling concepts, governing anisotropy of polarizability, phase transitions, morphology, time-dependent correlations, etc. are discussed. Crosslisted with MSE and PTFE 6755.

CHEM6756.subject: CHEM
CHEM6756.name: Signaling Molecules
CHEM6756.description: The diversity of chemical signals between organisms and their structural specificities will be presented along with chemical and biological methods for isolating signaling molecules. Crosslisted with BIOL 6756 and CEE 6756.

CHEM6760.subject: CHEM
CHEM6760.name: Biocatalysis
CHEM6760.description: This course provides in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts, their functioning in metabolic networks, their application in various industries, and recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHBE 6760.

CHEM6765.subject: CHEM
CHEM6765.name: Drug Development
CHEM6765.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process, including design of new drugs, synthesis and manufacturing issues, and methods of delivery into the body. Includes student presentations. Crosslisted with BMED 6765 and CHBE 6765.

CHEM7001.subject: CHEM
CHEM7001.name: Intro to Research
CHEM7001.description: Introduction to laboratory techniques, experimental design, library and database searching, presentations.

CHEM8813.subject: CHEM
CHEM8813.name: Spec Top-Inorganic Chem
CHEM8813.description: Topics from the inorganic chemistry research literature.

CHEM8823.subject: CHEM
CHEM8823.name: Spec Top-Analytical Chem
CHEM8823.description: Topics from the analytical chemistry research literature.

CHEM8833.subject: CHEM
CHEM8833.name: Spec Top-Organic Chem
CHEM8833.description: Topics from the organic chemistry research literature.

CHEM8843.subject: CHEM
CHEM8843.name: Spec Top-Physical Chem
CHEM8843.description: Topics from the physical chemistry research literature.

CHEM8853.subject: CHEM
CHEM8853.name: Spec Topics-Biochemistry
CHEM8853.description: Topics from the biochemistry research literature.

CHEM8873.subject: CHEM
CHEM8873.name: Spec Top-Polymer Chem
CHEM8873.description: Topics from the polymer chemistry research literature.

CHEM8997.name: Teaching Assistantship
CHEM8997.description: For graduate students holding graduate teaching assistantships.

CHEM8998.subject: CHEM
CHEM8998.name: Research Assistantship
CHEM8998.description: For graduate students holding graduate research assistantships.

CHIN1001.subject: CHIN
CHIN1001.name: Elementary Chinese I
CHIN1001.description: Performance-based training in pronunciation, tones, and sentence structure, developing a baseline for listening, speaking, reading, and writing Chinese, as well as fostering a sensitivity to Chinese culture. Humanities credit awarded for CHIN 1001 upon successful completion of CHIN 1002 or CHIN 2001.

CHIN1002.subject: CHIN
CHIN1002.name: Elementary Chinese II
CHIN1002.description: Continued performance-based training in phonetics, grammar, sentence structure, and characters; focusing in the similarities and differences between English and Chinese.

CHIN1011.subject: CHIN
CHIN1011.name: Accelerated Elem Chin I
CHIN1011.description: This is the first of two courses in the basic Chinese sequence geared for heritage learners at the elementary level. The pace is approximately 30% faster than the non-accelerated course.

CHIN1012.subject: CHIN
CHIN1012.name: Accelerated Elem Chin II
CHIN1012.description: This is the second of two courses in the basic Chinese sequence geared for heritage learners at the elementary level. The pace is approximately 30% faster than the non-accelerated course.

CHIN2012.description: This is the second of two courses at the intermediate level in the Chinese sequence geared for heritage learners. The pace is approximately 30% faster than the non-accelerated course.

CHIN3004.name: Advanced Chinese I
CHIN3004.description: Continued reinforcement of intermediate speaking, reading, and writing skills, and cultural knowledge to enhance students' communication ability in topics relating to contemporary life and Chinese society.

CHIN3021.description: Comprehension of and discussion about issues in contemporary Chinese culture.

CHIN3691.description: Reading, discussion and analysis of intermediate/advanced current events texts and authentic media. Part of the intensive summer Chinese language program (LBAT). Admission by application only.

CHIN3692.subject: CHIN
CHIN3692.name: Business Chinese
CHIN3692.description: Acquisition of business technology, protocols, decorum strategies and improvement of oral communication skills. Reading and writing of notes, correspondence, and reports. Part of the summer language program (LBAT). Admission by application only.

CHIN3693.subject: CHIN
CHIN3693.name: Conversation Practicum
CHIN3693.description: Language practicum in the local community with written and oral classroom presentations. Part of the intensive summer Chinese language program (LBAT). Admission by application only.

CHIN3696.name: Eco Dev & Sustainability
CHIN3696.description: Examines the world's most populous nation's assault on its environment and resources in the pursuit of rapid economic growth. Taught in Chinese.

CHIN4004.subject: CHIN
CHIN4004.name: Advanced Chinese III
CHIN4004.description: Further development of advanced communication abilities. Materials deal with the economic, cultural, social, and political changes in contemporary China. Taught in Chinese.

CHIN4006.subject: CHIN
CHIN4006.name: Intercultural Communictn
CHIN4006.description: This course enables students to acquire skills that facilitate understanding and create foundation for greater awareness of the parameters that define Sino-American intercultural discourse.

CHIN4021.subject: CHIN
CHIN4021.name: Adv Lang Music & Culture
CHIN4021.description: Utilizing popular songs/videos as cultural texts, this advanced language and culture course develops the students' listening, reading, writing, presentation, and web-based research in Chinese.

CHIN4022.subject: CHIN
CHIN4022.name: Kungfu Fiction/Pop Cult
CHIN4022.description: Utilizing authentic kungfu fiction texts, this advanced language and culture course develops students' listening, reading, writing, presentation, and web-based research, all in Chinese.

CHIN4023.subject: CHIN
CHIN4023.name: Strategy & Art of War
CHIN4023.description: Using classical texts and their modern Chinese translations, this advanced language course analyzes Chinese strategic language and thought, with Western cultural comparison. Taught in Chinese.

CHIN4031.subject: CHIN
CHIN4031.name: Chin-Language Cinema
CHIN4031.description: Utilizing selected Chinese films as texts, this advanced Chinese course focuses to discuss the topics dealing with the technological, cultural, and urban transformation in China.

CHIN4500.subject: CHIN
CHIN4500.name: Intercultural Seminar
CHIN4500.description: Iintegrates cross-cultural research and reflection into discussion of current issues in the chinese-speaking world. Intended for students who have had some study-abroad experience in China. Conducted in Chinese.

CHIN4695.subject: CHIN
CHIN4695.name: Chinese Internship
CHIN4695.description: Professional experience with a business/organization in which students enhance their language skills and cultural knowledge in Chinese in relation to the practical goals/objectives of the entity.

COA1011.name: Fund Design&Built Env I
COA1011.description: Introduction to creative problem-solving and the design realization cycle through project-based design exercises that emphasize the role of representation.

COA1012.subject: COA
COA1012.name: Fund Design&Built Env II
COA1012.description: Introduction to the design of complex problems through an emphasis on integrative and collaborative design strategies, research, critical reflection, and interdisciplinary team work.

COA1060.subject: COA
COA1060.name: Intro-Design&Built Env
COA1060.description: Introduction to architecture, building construction, and industrial design through case studies that illuminate past and present practices, as well as future possibilities within the disciplines.

COA2241.subject: COA
COA2241.name: History of Art I
COA2241.description: A survey of artistic manifestations from primitive times to the present. First semester sequence, prehistoric through Renaissance; second semester, Renaissance through contemporary art.

COA2242.subject: COA

COA2242.description: A survey of artistic manifestations from primitive times to the present. First semester sequence, prehistoric through Renaissance; second semester Renaissance through contemporary art.

COA3114.name: Architecture in Greece
COA3114.description: An intensive on-site investigation of the role that the arts and architecture have played in the development of classical Greek civilization.

COA3115.subject: COA
COA3115.name: Art & Arch in Italy I
COA3115.description: Investigations of the painting, sculpture, and architecture of the Classical, Early Christian, Byzantine, and Medieval periods in Italy with special emphasis on Rome.

COA3116.subject: COA
COA3116.name: Art & Arch in Italy II
COA3116.description: Investigations of the painting, sculpture, and architecture of the Renaissance and Baroque periods in Italy with special emphasis on the works of Rome.

COA4000.subject: COA
COA4000.name: Furniture Workshop
COA4000.description: The course investigates construction into the design cycle to explore the boundaries between furniture, architecture, and sculpture. Exercises introduce furniture production techniques, material properties, and CNC milling.

COA4010.subject: COA
COA4010.name: Construction Ind History
COA4010.description: Addresses how today's construction industry is organized and its particular characteristics, how it evolved from early times and where it may be heading in the future.

COA4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

COA6011.description: Urban design laboratory problems focusing on analysis, design, and implementation strategies for contemporary urban problems.
