HTS4928.name: Special Problems in HTS
HTS4928.description: Individual studies of topics of current interest in History, Technology, and Society.

HTS4929.subject: HTS
HTS4929.name: Special Problems in HTS
HTS4929.description: Individual studies of topics of current interest in History, Technology, and Society.

HTS4990.subject: HTS
HTS4990.name: HTS Internship
HTS4990.description: Recognition for a paid or unpaid, full or part-time, employment experience that is relevant to a student's history and sociology education.

HTS6001.subject: HTS
HTS6001.name: Proseminar-Social Theory
HTS6001.description: An introduction to key theoretical traditions in modern social theory, including both classical and contemporary works.

HTS6002.subject: HTS
HTS6002.name: Proseminar-Hist of Tech
HTS6002.description: Identifies major areas of interest in the history of technology and introduces a variety of approaches to the discipline.

HTS6101.subject: HTS
HTS6101.name: Soc & Pol Hist of U.S.
HTS6101.description: Examines the social experiences of Americans and the political contexts in which they lived.

HTS6102.subject: HTS
HTS6102.name: Soc & Pol Hist of Europe
HTS6102.description: Classic works and debates in European social history, including transition from feudalism to capitalism, French Revolution, rural history and industrialization, and origins of nationalism.

HTS6103.subject: HTS
HTS6103.name: Soc&Pol Hist-Nonwestern
HTS6103.description: Covers basic empirical and relevant theoretical literature in English on the social and political history of Africa, Asia, and/or Latin America.

HTS6106.subject: HTS
HTS6106.name: Business Org & Pol Econ
HTS6106.description: Examines the historical evolution and contemporary operations of business institutions within the larger context of political economy; emphasis on business, government, and technology.

HTS6110.subject: HTS
HTS6110.name: Gender,Science & Tech
HTS6110.description: Examines the ways in which gendered relations shape scientific and technological institutions, careers, artifacts, knowledge, and culture.

HTS6111.subject: HTS
HTS6111.name: Tech & Modern Culture
HTS6111.description: Introduces the complex interplay between technological systems and diffuse systems of consumption, social organization, and culture beyond the act of production.

HTS6112.subject: HTS
HTS6112.name: Studies-Science & Engr
HTS6112.description: Empirical investigation of scientific and engineering practice in historical and contemporary settings.

HTS6113.subject: HTS
HTS6113.name: Development Tech Sci
HTS6113.description: Explores the impact of science and technology on development and modernization. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6113 and HTS 4011.

HTS6114.subject: HTS
HTS6114.name: Hist Science
HTS6114.description: Explores topics in the history of science in their social and political contexts.

HTS6115.subject: HTS
HTS6115.name: Sociology Sci Tech
HTS6115.description: Explores current debates in the history of the sociology of science and technology. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6115 and HTS 3082.

HTS6116.subject: HTS
HTS6116.name: Environmental History
HTS6116.description: Surveys the field of global environmental history with examples taken from biology, geography, sociology and anthropology.

HTS6117.subject: HTS
HTS6117.name: Urbanization
HTS6117.description: An intensive introduction to the political, social, and economic forces involved in the process of urbanization. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6117 and HTS 6105.

HTS6118.subject: HTS
HTS6118.name: Sci Tech & The Economy
HTS6118.description: Examines how science and technology are related to economic institutions and processes. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6118 and HTS 6107.

HTS6119.subject: HTS
HTS6119.name: Race and Ethnicity
HTS6119.description: Examines the structural impact of racism and ethnic discrimination on American society, and the controversies over racial and ethnic identity. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6119 and HTS 6108.

HTS6120.subject: HTS
HTS6120.name: Inequality Sci Tech
HTS6120.description: Explores the impacts of science and technology on inequality, as well as how notions of difference have shaped science and technology. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6120 and HTS 6109.

HTS6121.subject: HTS
HTS6121.name: Science Tech Security
HTS6121.description: Topics in the study of the relationship between national security and the scientific-technological enterprise from diverse perspectives.

HTS6122.subject: HTS
HTS6122.name: History of Medicine
HTS6122.description: The impact of disease in history, modern developments in medicine and health focusing on western medicine in a global context.

HTS6123.subject: HTS
HTS6123.name: Social & Cultural BIOMED
HTS6123.description: Introduces students to the changing social, political, and corporate worlds of the biological sciences, biotechnology, and biomedicine.

HTS6124.subject: HTS
HTS6124.name: Sci&Tech Beyond Borders
HTS6124.description: Discusses the roles of science and technology as instruments of social control and of social change in development and modernization. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6124 and HTS 6104.

HTS6743.subject: HTS
HTS6743.name: STS Core Seminar
HTS6743.description: This survey course covers key works in Science, Technology & Society, and guest lectures introduce students to faculty doing STS-related research across the Ivan Allen College. Credit not allowed for both HTS 6743 and PUBP 6743 or LCC 6743.

HTS7001.subject: HTS
HTS7001.name: Sociohistorical Analysis
HTS7001.description: Introduces key concepts and methods used in the historical analysis of social phenomena.

HTS7002.subject: HTS
HTS7002.name: Research & Writing Sem
HTS7002.description: Introduces methods of sociohistorical research and writing; requires preparation of an original research paper based on primary sources.

HTS8001.subject: HTS
HTS8001.name: Labor,Indus,Tech&Society
HTS8001.description: An intensive, team-taught reading seminar covering major themes and classic works in these fields.

HTS8997.subject: HTS
HTS8997.name: Teaching Assistantship
HTS8997.description: For graduate students holding a teaching assistantship.

HTS8998.subject: HTS
HTS8998.name: Research Assistantship
HTS8998.description: For graduate students holding a research assistantship.

ID2011.subject: ID
ID2011.name: Intro to Design I
ID2011.description: Foundation course in visual communications theory and practice, continuing the development of two-dimensional visual literacy. Emphasis on both analog and digital media.

ID2012.subject: ID
ID2012.name: Intro to Design II
ID2012.description: Foundation course in form giving and representing, continuing the development of three-dimensional visual literacy. Emphasis on visual relationships between form and image.

ID2021.subject: ID
ID2021.name: ID Studio 1
ID2021.description: This course provides an introduction to the design process on visual principles and presentation techniques with a focus on sketching and modeling techniques related to 3D form.

ID2022.subject: ID
ID2022.name: ID Studio 2
ID2022.description: This course applies more structured design methods to research and exploration of product form and function and introduces concepts of universal design and user centered design.

ID2201.subject: ID
ID2201.name: Issues for Design
ID2201.description: Introduction to the broad environmental issues that face humankind as a participant in the biosphere.

ID2202.subject: ID
ID2202.name: Hist-Modern Indust Dsgn
ID2202.description: History and development of industrial design from the beginning of the Industrial Revolution to the present.

ID2320.subject: ID
ID2320.name: Human Factors in Design
ID2320.description: This course examines the theory of Human Factors to provide a working knowledge of the physical and cognitive attributes of people that designers must accomodate.

ID2401.subject: ID
ID2401.name: Visual Design Thinking
ID2401.description: Introduction to techniques to help designers build a vocabulary to support effective visual communication including fundamentals of layout, sketching, rendering, schematics, information graphics & storyboarding.

ID2698.subject: ID
ID2698.name: Research Assistantship
ID2698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID2699.subject: ID
ID2699.name: Undergraduate Research
ID2699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID3011.subject: ID
ID3011.name: Intermediate Design I
ID3011.description: The systematic design process as applied to industrial design and packaging problems.

ID3012.subject: ID
ID3012.name: Intermediate Design II
ID3012.description: Various dimensions of human factors applied to design, including: aging, disability, normal age change, childhood and adult anthropometrics, and human capability.

ID3031.subject: ID
ID3031.name: Health Des Studio 1
ID3031.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of new and/or improved health-related products with an emphasis on inclusive design.

ID3032.subject: ID
ID3032.name: Health Des Studio 2
ID3032.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of new and/or improved health-related products with an emphasis on products and product systems.

ID3041.subject: ID
ID3041.name: Product Dev Studio 1
ID3041.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the use of parametric design and CNC capabilities in the design development of products, services & systems.

ID3042.subject: ID
ID3042.name: Product Dev Studio 2
ID3042.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of 'real-world' products, services & systems in collaboration with external sponsors.

ID3051.subject: ID
ID3051.name: Interactive ID Studio 1
ID3051.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on new applications of sensor-based technologies with an emphasis on the importance of user-centered design.

ID3052.subject: ID
ID3052.name: Interactive ID Studio 2
ID3052.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on new applications of sensor-based technologies with an emphasis on interactive environments, navigation and mobility.

ID3201.subject: ID
ID3201.name: Design and Community
ID3201.description: Students explore socially and environmentally responsible industrial design practices at home and abroad, and partner with local organizations to develop community-based design projects.

ID3301.subject: ID
ID3301.name: Materials I
ID3301.description: This course examines the characteristics, production technologies, histories, and environmental impacts of nine categories of renewable materials familiar to industrial design.

ID3302.subject: ID
ID3302.name: Materials II
ID3302.description: Examination of characteristics, production technologies, histories, and environmental impacts of nonrenewable materials used in industrial design.

ID3320.subject: ID
ID3320.name: Design Methods
ID3320.description: This course introduces students to current user-centric design methods used to identify, understand, assess and prioritize the factors that contribute to more effective design solutions.

ID3510.subject: ID
ID3510.name: Interactive Products
ID3510.description: This course provides an introduction to interactive product design including the basics of sensor technologies, electronics and programming required to produce working product concept prototypes.

ID3520.subject: ID
ID3520.name: Tangible Interaction
ID3520.description: This course addresses the design process related to interactive environments. Projects will emphasize the inclusion of ubiquitous and emerging interactive technologies.

ID3803.subject: ID
ID3803.name: Special Topics
ID3803.description: Topics of current interest in industrial design.

ID3813.subject: ID
ID3813.name: Special Topics
ID3813.description: Topics of current interest in Industrial Design.

ID4011.subject: ID
ID4011.name: Advanced Design I
ID4011.description: Application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary design problems. Experience in solving real design problems from areas such as consumer products and equipment, transportation and equipment.

ID4012.subject: ID
ID4012.name: Advanced Design II
ID4012.description: Capstone industrial design project of student's own choosing, with consent of instructor, to refine problem-solving and design ability in preparation for professional practice.

ID4061.subject: ID
ID4061.name: ID Capstone Des Studio 1
ID4061.description: Comprehensive team-based projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products, & systems with emphasis on integration of research, design, prototyping and testing.

ID4062.subject: ID
ID4062.name: ID Capstone Des Studio 2
ID4062.description: Comprehensive individual projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products, & systems with emphasis on integration of research, design, prototyping and testing.

ID4071.subject: ID
ID4071.name: Invention Studio 1
ID4071.description: Comprehensive projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products, systems & services with emphasis on invention, design and manufacturing.

ID4072.subject: ID
ID4072.name: Invention Studio 2
ID4072.description: Comprehensive projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products, systems & services with emphasis on invention, innovation and entrepreneurship.

ID4081.subject: ID
ID4081.name: ID/ME Colab Des Studio 1
ID4081.description: An interdisciplinary team-based approach to integrate industrial design and engineering competencies in design development of products and systems with emphasis on corporate-sponsored projects.

ID4082.subject: ID
ID4082.name: ID/ME Colab Des Studio 2
ID4082.description: An interdisciplinary team-based approach to integrate industrial design and engineering competencies in design development of products and systems with emphasis on humanitarian projects.

ID4103.subject: ID
ID4103.name: Alias Studio I
ID4103.description: Introduction to modeling, rendering, and animation with Alias Studio software.

ID4104.subject: ID
ID4104.name: Alias Studio II
ID4104.description: Introduction to product animation using Alias Studio software.

ID4105.subject: ID
ID4105.name: Adv Modeling Concepts
ID4105.description: The Advance Modeling Concepts Course explores concepts, tools and theories used to model and validate complex forms encountered in the product design process.

ID4106.subject: ID
ID4106.name: Parametric Product Model
ID4106.description: This course focuses on advanced digital methods in product modeling for visual analysis, flexible design approaches and digital fabrication methods.

ID4201.subject: ID
ID4201.name: Design/Research Methods
ID4201.description: Research methods applicable to industrial design including task definition, information gathering, and analysis.

ID4202.subject: ID
ID4202.name: Professional Practice
ID4202.description: Principles of consulting and corporate industrial design including preparation of the professional portfolio.

ID4203.subject: ID
ID4203.name: French Society & Culture
ID4203.description: Studies in French society and culture.

ID4204.subject: ID
ID4204.name: Theorizing Design
ID4204.description: Introduction to what designers do and how they undertake their tasks; examples will come from a variety of design disciplines.

ID4205.subject: ID
ID4205.name: French Design & Culture
ID4205.description: Studies in French design and culture.

ID4206.subject: ID
ID4206.name: Culture of Objects
ID4206.description: This seminar surveys the theories and methodologies within the field of industrial design that locate meaning in the designed object as derived from culture.

ID4210.subject: ID
ID4210.name: Intro Universal Design
ID4210.description: This course provides an introduction to universal design focusing on the implications of ability on the usability of places, products, and systems for all individuals.

ID4320.subject: ID
ID4320.name: Prototyping Interaction
ID4320.description: This course exposes students to a range of practical methods for research and design exploration to support the design development of interactive products and technologies.

ID4418.subject: ID
ID4418.name: Design Sketching
ID4418.description: This course addresses drawing and visualization techniques necessary for design thinking and development and introduces methods and processes to formulate and present visual information.

ID4450.subject: ID
ID4450.name: Portfolio Development
ID4450.description: The portfolio development course provides students with a structured approach to preparing a professional visual record of their work in print and digital formats.

ID4510.subject: ID
ID4510.name: Wearable Product Design
ID4510.description: Wearable Product Design explores techniques in producing designs and prototypes for on-body interactions, and general textile knowledge for making effective wearable products.

ID4698.subject: ID
ID4698.name: Research Assistantship
ID4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID4699.subject: ID
ID4699.name: Undergraduate Research
ID4699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID4803.subject: ID
ID4803.name: Special Topics-Furniture
ID4803.description: Special topics in furniture design not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID4813.subject: ID
ID4813.name: Spec Top: Sustainability
ID4813.description: Special topics in sustainability not included in the professional curriculum.

ID4823.subject: ID
ID4823.name: Special Topic-Info Tech
ID4823.description: Special topics in information technology not included in the professional curriculum.

ID4833.subject: ID
ID4833.name: Spec Top: Collaborative
ID4833.description: Application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary problems by a team. Projects from a range of interest areas: consumer, industrial products, transportation, furniture.

ID4843.subject: ID
ID4843.name: Spec Topics: Hist/Theory
ID4843.description: Special topics in history and theory not included in the professional curriculum.

ID4900.subject: ID
ID4900.name: Spec Prob: Visual Comm
ID4900.description: Special problems in communication not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID4901.subject: ID
ID4901.name: Spec Prob:Mentor Program
ID4901.description: Special problems in teaching pedagogy; mentoring by senior faculty in basic and intermediate design courses.

ID4902.subject: ID
ID4902.name: Spec Prob:Mentor Program
ID4902.description: Special problems in teaching pedagogy; mentoring by senior faculty in basic and intermediate design courses.

ID4903.subject: ID
ID4903.name: Special Prob: Research
ID4903.description: Special research topics for advanced students not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID4904.subject: ID
ID4904.name: Special Prob: Research
ID4904.description: Special research topics for advanced students not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID6100.subject: ID
ID6100.name: Intro to ID Grad Studies
ID6100.description: Introduction to the theory and practice of graduate studies in Industrial Design in relation to behavior research and consumer products.

ID6101.subject: ID
ID6101.name: Human Centered Design
ID6101.description: This course examines design artifacts in relation to the human body, aging, disabilities, and environments.

ID6200.subject: ID
ID6200.name: Graduate Studio I
ID6200.description: Graduate application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary design problems. Experience in solving real design problems for consumer products.

ID6201.subject: ID
ID6201.name: Graduate Studio II
ID6201.description: Graduate-level application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary problems.

ID6214.subject: ID
ID6214.name: Strategic Design Language
ID6214.description: Introduction to techniques to help designers clarify and support design ideas in a strategic business context by exploring methods to better leverage visual design skills.

ID6215.subject: ID
ID6215.name: Service Design
ID6215.description: This course introduces best practices of service design and focuses on the alignment and design of multiple brand touch points to optimize customer experience.

ID6271.subject: ID
ID6271.name: Healthcare Des of Future
ID6271.description: Introduction to research-based approaches to integrated healthcare design innovation.

ID6400.subject: ID
ID6400.name: Master's Project
ID6400.description: Student produces a product prototype that must meet with instructor's approval.

ID6401.subject: ID
ID6401.name: Visualizing Interaction
ID6401.description: Introduction to techniques that empower designers to plan and create effective and clear visual communication depicting the interaction and relationships between people, products, and services.

ID6420.subject: ID
ID6420.name: Advanced Sketching
ID6420.description: This class will focus on developing advanced, traditional (non-digital) sketching, rendering, and presentation techniques.

ID6509.subject: ID
ID6509.name: Comp Creativity Des Cogn
ID6509.description: This course investigates computational methods, models, tools that support design creativity and cognition. Credit not allowed for both ID 6509 and ARCH 6509.

ID6510.subject: ID
ID6510.name: Design for Interaction
ID6510.description: This course examines opportunities for designers to leverage visualization and prototyping methods to foster new applications of technology to enhance user experience in everyday life.

ID6515.subject: ID
ID6515.name: Interface Prototyping
ID6515.description: This course focuses on the development of interactive prototypes for digital displays. Students learn how graphic and interactive design principles can be represented through prototypes.

ID6753.subject: ID
ID6753.name: HCI Prof Prep & Practice
ID6753.description: Preparation for a professional career in HCI. Speakers. Atlanta-area lab visits. Career trajectories. Project presentations. Technical, resume and interviewing skills. Atlanta-area HCI resources.

ID6763.subject: ID
ID6763.name: Design Interactv Environ
ID6763.description: Investigate and design ambient, intelligent, interactive interfaces and computational applications in tangible and physical environment to support health, wellness and quality of life. Credit not allowed for both ID 6763 and COA 6763 or CS 6763.

ID6800.subject: ID
ID6800.name: Adv Universal Design
ID6800.description: This course provides an advanced level to universal design focusing on the implications of ability on the usability of places, products, and systems for all individuals.

ID6820.subject: ID
ID6820.name: Web Usability & Access
ID6820.description: This course will teach students the fundamentals of web design and usability issues in online environments, with an emphasis on universal design principles and accessibility.

ID6998.subject: ID
ID6998.name: HCI Master's Project
ID6998.description: Final project for students completing a Human-Computer Interaction master's degree in the Digitial Media track. Repeatable for multi-semester projects.

ID7000.subject: ID
ID7000.name: Master's Thesis
ID7000.description: Provides students with the opportunity to pursue advanced research under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID8903.subject: ID
ID8903.name: Special Problems in HCI
ID8903.description: Small-group of individual investigation of advanced topics in human-computer interaction. Guided study and research.

IL6450.subject: IL
IL6450.name: Analytical Methods
IL6450.description: This course provides an overview of optimization, statistical, and stochastic models and methods with special emphasis on application to logistics.

IL6451.subject: IL
IL6451.name: Demand and Yield Mgt
IL6451.description: This course focuses on demand estimation and modeling and revenue management.

IL6452.subject: IL
IL6452.name: Reverse Green Logistics
IL6452.description: This course addresses issues, driving forces, and analytical approaches to aid in designing operating reverse logistics systems.

IL6453.subject: IL
IL6453.name: Labor Relations
IL6453.description: This course compares labor practices in Europe, North America, and Asia with special attention on the influences on logistics.

IL6454.subject: IL
IL6454.name: European Trade&Transport
IL6454.description: This course provides an overview of legal, cultural, political, and infrastructure issues influencing logistics in Europe.

IL6455.subject: IL
IL6455.name: Finance for Logistics
IL6455.description: This course provides an in-depth understanding of concepts of finance that relate to logistics, such as valuing logistics activities and measuring logistics performance.

IL6456.subject: IL
IL6456.name: Financial Decisions
IL6456.description: This course provides a thorough understanding of the key elements of building a better logistics business case.

IL6457.subject: IL
IL6457.name: American Trade&Transport
IL6457.description: This course provides an overview of legal, cultural, political, and infrastructure issues influencing logistics practices in the Americas.

IL6458.subject: IL
IL6458.name: Warehousing
IL6458.description: This course surveys the different types of warehouses and their functions, principles of operation, and strategic relationship to the supply chain.

IL6459.subject: IL
IL6459.name: Intl Trade & Transport
IL6459.description: This course discusses how international trade is financed, what instruments are used and how they work, how transactions are settled, and the role of documentation.

IL6460.subject: IL
IL6460.name: Intl Freight Management
IL6460.description: This course focuses on international freight management including consolidation, export packaging, customs, tracking, terminal operations, mode selection, and carrier selection.

IL6461.subject: IL
IL6461.name: Asian Trade & Transport
IL6461.description: This course provides an overview of legal, cultural, political, and infrastructure issues influencing logistics practices in Asia.

IL6464.subject: IL
IL6464.name: ERP Systems
IL6464.description: This course provides a strategic view of Enterprise Resource Planning and its relationship to logistics functions.

IL6465.subject: IL
IL6465.name: Marketing Channels
IL6465.description: This course focuses on logistics and supply chain issues as they impact the global marketing strategies of companies.

IL6466.subject: IL
IL6466.name: Global Supply Chain
IL6466.description: This course focuses on concepts and models for designing and measuring a global supply chain, with special focus on the impact of e-commerce.

IL6467.subject: IL
IL6467.name: Transportation
IL6467.description: This course focuses on logistics planning, execution, and performance measurement in the transportation industry.

IL6468.subject: IL
IL6468.name: Manufacturing
IL6468.description: This course focuses on logistics issues within the manufacturing facility including inventory, throughput, lead-time batching, and managing variability.

IL6472.subject: IL
IL6472.name: Supply Chain Lab III
IL6472.description: This course integrates supply chain management techniques in the Americas, Asia, and Europe through case studies.

IL6475.subject: IL
IL6475.name: Cases-Intl Logistics I
IL6475.description: In this course, cases are used to integrate strategic, management, and operating issues in international logistics and supply chain design.

IL6476.subject: IL
IL6476.name: Cases-Intl Logistics II
IL6476.description: In this course, cases are used t integrate strategic, management, and operating issues in international logistics and supply chain design.

IL6477.subject: IL
IL6477.name: Cases-Intl Logistics III
IL6477.description: In this course, cases are used to integrate strategic, management, and operating issues in international logistics and supply chain design.

IL6478.subject: IL
IL6478.name: Cases-Intl Logistics IV
IL6478.description: In this course, cases are used to integrate strategic, management, and operating issues in international logistics and supply chain design.

IL6480.subject: IL
IL6480.name: Supply Chain Lab I
IL6480.description: This course integrates supply chain management techniques in the region through readings, case studies, meetings and site visits. Typically Supply Chain Lab I focuses on the US. Credit not allowed for both IL 6480 and IL 6470.

IL6481.subject: IL
IL6481.name: Supply Chain Lab II
IL6481.description: This course integrates supply chain management techniques in the region through readings, case studies, meetings and site visits. Typically Supply Chain Lab II focuses on Europe. Credit not allowed for both IL 6481 and IL 6471.

IL6483.subject: IL
IL6483.name: Supply Chain Lab IV
IL6483.description: This course integrates supply chain management techniques in the region through readings, case studies, meetings and site visits. Typically Supply Chain Lab IV focuses on Asia. Credit not allowed for both IL 6483 and IL 6473.

IL6484.subject: IL
IL6484.name: Supply Chain Lab V
IL6484.description: This course integrates supply chain management techinques in the region through readings, case studies, meetings, and site visits. Typically Supply Chain Lab V focuses on Mexico and NAFTA. Credit not allowed for both IL 6484 and IL 6474.

IMBA6000.subject: IMBA
IMBA6000.name: Decision Making
IMBA6000.description: A multifirm, competitive management simulation. The objective is to sharpen intra-firm communications skills using the internet as the communications channel and the art of compromise.

IMBA6010.subject: IMBA
IMBA6010.name: Cross Cultural Commun
IMBA6010.description: Participants learn tools and information to improve communications skills with new approaches and increased understanding while taking into account the effects of cross-cultural differences on communications.

IMBA6021.subject: IMBA
IMBA6021.name: Data Analysis for Bus
IMBA6021.description: Covers common statistical tools for the analysis of corporate data such as descriptive statistics, probability concepts, sampling and estimation, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.

IMBA6030.subject: IMBA
IMBA6030.name: Org Behavior and Theory
IMBA6030.description: Students learn the basic concepts and principles of organizational behavior and utilize such to analyze and solve organizational decision-making problems.

IMBA6031.subject: IMBA
IMBA6031.name: Leadershp & Org Behavior
IMBA6031.description: This course focuses on the challenges in leading teams and organizations in increasingly complex, global, and dynamic business environments.

IMBA6040.subject: IMBA
IMBA6040.name: Global Economics
IMBA6040.description: Participants are provided with a non-traditional approach using an analytical method with a global perspective to the concepts and role of economics in the world environment.

IMBA6050.subject: IMBA
IMBA6050.name: Fin & Managerial Account
IMBA6050.description: Course covers financial reporting and analysis issues facing firms, and managerial accounting information necessary for planning, controlling, and decision making within such firms.

IMBA6061.subject: IMBA
IMBA6061.name: Information Systems
IMBA6061.description: Tools and techniques to manage the information technology infrastructure that supports a global organization.

IMBA6070.subject: IMBA
IMBA6070.name: World Finance
IMBA6070.description: A two-part course providing an understanding of finance concepts and how they are used. The course then further integrates international and ethical considerations wherever applicable.

IMBA6071.subject: IMBA
IMBA6071.name: Financial Management
IMBA6071.description: An introduction to finance. Topics include time value of money, capital budgeting, risk and return, capital structure, dividend policy, and working capital management.

IMBA6081.subject: IMBA
IMBA6081.name: Manf and Service Mgt
IMBA6081.description: Covers the basic conceptual and analytical skills that are required in managing operations and confronting operational problems in competitive markets.

IMBA6090.subject: IMBA
IMBA6090.name: Marketing&Consumer Behav
IMBA6090.description: Students are provided with an understanding of marketing and consumer behavior concepts and tools with an international environment approach.

IMBA6101.subject: IMBA
IMBA6101.name: Prod Strat for Glob Mkts
IMBA6101.description: Developing and marketing new products and services with an emphasis on international markets.

IMBA6110.subject: IMBA
IMBA6110.name: Risk Management
IMBA6110.description: A course based upon a combination of cases, historical data, and theoretical interpretation on the analysis and allocation of risk in international investment and technology transfer.

IMBA6121.subject: IMBA
IMBA6121.name: Global Workforce Mgt
IMBA6121.description: A survey of global workforce management principles and the skills necessary to function effectively in a supervisory role in a global organization.

IMBA6131.subject: IMBA
IMBA6131.name: Strategic Management
IMBA6131.description: Integrate knowledge of the functional areas of a business to understand how firms gain and sustain a competitive advantage in a globally competitive environment.

IMBA6140.subject: IMBA
IMBA6140.name: Comparative Systems
IMBA6140.description: This course utilizes case studies of companies in various industries and in national cultures to highlight organizational and cultural differences between major economies in the global environment.

IMBA6150.subject: IMBA
IMBA6150.name: Entrepreneurship
IMBA6150.description: Participants explore the increasing importance of small and medium-sized businesses and new ventures in international business.

IMBA6160.subject: IMBA
IMBA6160.name: Business Regulations
IMBA6160.description: Deals with learning how to control the legal aspects of international decisions.

IMBA6170.subject: IMBA
IMBA6170.name: Quality,Sust Tech,Compet
IMBA6170.description: Students learn the philosophy and techniques of strategic quality management while focusing on assessment and group decisions centered on sustaining technology and competitiveness.

IMBA6180.subject: IMBA
IMBA6180.name: Leadership Skills
IMBA6180.description: Focuses on identifying and developing the attributes of successful leadership.

IMBA6200.subject: IMBA
IMBA6200.name: Strategic Bus Simulation
IMBA6200.description: A unifying course providing a simulated application of the material taught in the core courses of the program.

IMBA6210.subject: IMBA
IMBA6210.name: Analy of Emerging Tech
IMBA6210.description: A case-based course dealing with the role and impact of digital technology in large and small organizations, with special emphasis on multinational companies.

IMBA6220.subject: IMBA
IMBA6220.name: Entrepreneurship Seminar
IMBA6220.description: A case course building an information bank of theory and practice on start-up enterprises. Several entrepreneurs will co-teach the course with a faculty leader.

IMBA6230.subject: IMBA
IMBA6230.name: Intl Bus Negotiations
IMBA6230.description: A role-play course involving the complex international negotiation simulation dealing with an international business enterprise and its relationship with one or more governments.

IMBA6240.subject: IMBA
IMBA6240.name: Ethics in Global Bus
IMBA6240.description: Examines the appropriate roles of business in global society, the roles of government and regulation in monitoring business, and the ethical responsibilitites of managers in global organizations.

IMBA6250.subject: IMBA
IMBA6250.name: International Finance
IMBA6250.description: Analysis of foreign exchange markets, exchange rate risk management, international portfolio investments, international asset pricing, cross-border M&A, and equilibrium conditions in international markets.

IMBA6260.subject: IMBA
IMBA6260.name: Glob Supp Chain & E-Comm
IMBA6260.description: Examines business, managerial and economic issues in the management of global supply chains and the role of electronic commerce in the supply chain.

IMBA6300.subject: IMBA
IMBA6300.name: Anal of Global Env I
IMBA6300.description: Analysis of a specific region through an international study tour with emphasis on understanding the economy, culture and business environment.

IMBA6310.subject: IMBA
IMBA6310.name: Anal of Global Env II
IMBA6310.description: Analysis of a specific region through an international study tour with emphasis on understanding the economy, culture and business environment.

IMBA6311.subject: IMBA
IMBA6311.name: Anal of Global Environ
IMBA6311.description: Analysis of a specific region through an international study tour with emphasis on understanding its economy, culture and business environment.

IMBA6400.subject: IMBA
IMBA6400.name: Global Strategy Proj I
IMBA6400.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on data collection and problem definition.

IMBA6401.subject: IMBA
IMBA6401.name: Global Strategy Proj I
IMBA6401.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on problem definition, data collection and client engagement management.

IMBA6410.subject: IMBA
IMBA6410.name: Global Strategy Proj II
IMBA6410.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on defining a preliminary solution that has desirable characteristics.

IMBA6411.subject: IMBA
IMBA6411.name: Global Strategy Proj II
IMBA6411.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on problem definition, data collection and client engagement management.

IMBA6420.subject: IMBA
IMBA6420.name: Global Strategy Proj III
IMBA6420.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on defining and presenting a comprehensive solution.

IMBA6430.subject: IMBA
IMBA6430.name: Bus Str Sustainability
IMBA6430.description: Cross-functional strategies to address competitive and regulatory demands placed on firms for achieving sustainable business practices.

INTA1002.subject: INTA
INTA1002.name: Effective Study Abroad
INTA1002.description: Introduces essential background information concerning countries, concepts, and what to do in order to gain maximum benefit from participation in school-sponsored study abroad programs.

INTA1050.subject: INTA
INTA1050.name: The World Today
INTA1050.description: Introduction to current issues of politics, geography, and history around the globe, using a wide variety of media and sources.

INTA1110.subject: INTA
INTA1110.name: Intro to Int'l Relations
INTA1110.description: An introduction to the major principles, concepts, actors, and theories of the international system and their application to current issues in world affairs.

INTA1200.subject: INTA
INTA1200.name: American Government
INTA1200.description: Examines American government in relation to other political and economic systems in countries around the world. Credit not allowed for both POL 1101 and INTA 1200.

INTA2001.subject: INTA
INTA2001.name: Careers In Intl Affairs
INTA2001.description: Reinforces career development and planning process for international affairs majors. Includes facilitation of decision-making skills, job search strategies, self-assessment, and overview from industry speakers. Credit not allowed for both INTA 2001 and INTA 1001.

INTA2010.subject: INTA
INTA2010.name: Empirical Methods
INTA2010.description: Develops skills in research design, model building, and hypothesis construction. Provides experience in using computer software programs to perform statistical tests including t-tests, chi-square, and regression.

INTA2030.subject: INTA
INTA2030.name: Ethics in Int'l Affairs
INTA2030.description: Surveys the main traditions and theories of international ethics with a focus on intervention and the use of force, human rights, self-determination, and global distributive justice.

INTA2040.subject: INTA
INTA2040.name: Sci,Tech & Int'l Affairs
INTA2040.description: An overview of science and technology as a determinant in the development and functioning of states and societies worldwide and the international context for the development of science and technology.

INTA2042.subject: INTA
INTA2042.name: Intro-Global WMD Issues
INTA2042.description: This course will explore the challenges, history, and major theoretical frameworks relating to weapons of mass destruction (WMD).

INTA2050.subject: INTA
INTA2050.name: Intro to Global Develpmt
INTA2050.description: Mainstream and critical approaches to development, the role of diverse institutions and projects, and implications for sustainability in the countries of the global south.

INTA2100.subject: INTA
INTA2100.name: Great Power Relations
INTA2100.description: Juxtaposes competing explanations for the patterns of conflict and cooperation among nations, illustrated by relations among the great powers of Europe and Asia during the past two centuries.

INTA2120.subject: INTA
INTA2120.name: Intro to Intl Security
INTA2120.description: Introduction to the role of theory and provide an understanding of the significance of various issues in international security.

INTA2210.subject: INTA
INTA2210.name: Pol Phil & Ideologies
INTA2210.description: Explores political ideologies and philosophies, including theories of democracy, capitalism, and socialism, as well as rival views of the "good society" in comparative and historical perspective.

INTA2220.subject: INTA
INTA2220.name: Govt& Pol-Western Europe
INTA2220.description: A comparative analysis of the politics and major institutions of the countries of contemporary Western Europe.

INTA2221.subject: INTA
INTA2221.name: Politics of the EU
INTA2221.description: Introduction and overview of the history and politics of the European Union from its inception to the new era of development under the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

INTA2230.subject: INTA
INTA2230.name: Govt & Politics of Asia
INTA2230.description: An introduction to the major issues and aspects of the politics, societies, and cultures of East Asia, and the changing role of the region in international affairs.

INTA2241.subject: INTA
INTA2241.name: Govt Pol Soc-Lat America
INTA2241.description: Introduction to the study of historical forces, cultural production, identity, political development and contemporary issues in Latin America.

INTA2260.subject: INTA
INTA2260.name: Govt Pol Soc-Middle East
INTA2260.description: Introduction to the study and analysis of contemporary Middle East politics with an emphasis on the Arab states.

INTA2698.subject: INTA
INTA2698.name: Research Assistantship
INTA2698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

INTA2699.subject: INTA
INTA2699.name: Undergraduate Research
INTA2699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

INTA2803.subject: INTA
INTA2803.name: Special Topics
INTA2803.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA2813.subject: INTA
INTA2813.name: Special Topics
INTA2813.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA2823.subject: INTA
INTA2823.name: Special Topics
INTA2823.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA2833.subject: INTA
INTA2833.name: Special Topics
INTA2833.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA2901.subject: INTA
INTA2901.name: Special Problems
INTA2901.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA2902.subject: INTA
INTA2902.name: Special Problems
INTA2902.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA2903.subject: INTA
INTA2903.name: Special Problems
INTA2903.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA3010.subject: INTA
INTA3010.name: Intl Technology Transfer
INTA3010.description: Explores the impact of technology transfer on key contexts such as economic development and the international diffusion of defense production and technology.

INTA3012.subject: INTA
INTA3012.name: War in the 20th Century
INTA3012.description: Provides historical foundation and understanding of the causes, conduct and consequences of modern war to support informed discussion and analysis of contemporary crisis and conflict.

INTA3020.subject: INTA
INTA3020.name: Contemporary Mexico
INTA3020.description: This course examines the socio-economic and political history and development of twentieth century Mexico, with a focus on current problems and issues.

INTA3031.subject: INTA
INTA3031.name: Human Rights
INTA3031.description: Explores how processes of globalization and advances in communication and technology have heightened and shaped human rights as a concern in international politics.

INTA3042.subject: INTA
INTA3042.name: Energy & Intl Security
INTA3042.description: Examines issues at the intersection of national energy security and international conflict and cooperation.

INTA3043.subject: INTA
INTA3043.name: Space Policy
INTA3043.description: Examination of the origins, evolution and range of current challenges and debates in international space policy issues, including civil, military, and commercial activities.

INTA3044.subject: INTA
INTA3044.name: Global Politics of Tech
INTA3044.description: Examination of the economic and political dynamics that influence how regulations governing technology are adopted around the world.

INTA3050.subject: INTA
INTA3050.name: Global Citizenship
INTA3050.description: Explore the meaning of global citizenship in scholarly and public debates and how it is "practiced" by individuals and "institutionalized" by universities, corporations and organizations.

INTA3101.subject: INTA
INTA3101.name: Int'l Institutions
INTA3101.description: Scrutinizes the evolution of international institutions, and juxtaposes competing theoretical approaches for understanding the changing roles and functions of institutions in world affairs.

INTA3102.subject: INTA
INTA3102.name: Problem of Proliferation
INTA3102.description: Explores the political and economic issues, both international as well as domestic, involved in the spread of the weapons of mass destruction since the end of the Second World War.

INTA3103.subject: INTA
INTA3103.name: Challenge of Terrorism
INTA3103.description: Examines the contexts that nurture domestic and international terrorism, the variety of terrorist organizations, and alternative approaches to combating the problem.

INTA3104.subject: INTA
INTA3104.name: Int'l Negotations
INTA3104.description: Examines the theories of bargaining and negotiation, with an emphasis on explaining success and failure in U.S. foreign policy and national security negotiations.

INTA3110.subject: INTA
INTA3110.name: U.S. Foreign Policy
INTA3110.description: Analyzes the formulation and implementation of America's foreign policy from 1914 to the present, stressing economic, political, and strategic factors.

INTA3111.subject: INTA
INTA3111.name: U.S. Defense Policy
INTA3111.description: Examines contemporary American defense policy, including the formulation of strategy, the defense budget, force structure, and nontraditional uses of military force.

INTA3120.subject: INTA
INTA3120.name: European Security Issues
INTA3120.description: Explores the contemporary European security environment, including threats, challenges, and various security architectures (e.g., NATO, the WEU, and the OSCE).

INTA3121.subject: INTA
INTA3121.name: Russia and Eurasia
INTA3121.description: Examines the many dimensions of the foreign and security policies of Russia and the other new post-Soviet states of Russia and Eurasia.

INTA3130.subject: INTA
INTA3130.name: Foreign Policy of China
INTA3130.description: Analyzes the major dimensions of the foreign policies of the People's Republic of China and the domestic and international influences shaping those policies.

INTA3131.subject: INTA
INTA3131.name: Pacific Security Issues
INTA3131.description: Examines past, present, and future security concerns in the Pacific, including the Korean peninsula, Japanese defense, the emergence of China as a military power, and the forward basing of American troops and materiel.

INTA3203.subject: INTA
INTA3203.name: Comparative Politics
INTA3203.description: Contrasts competing theoretical perspectives in the comparative analysis of political systems.

INTA3220.subject: INTA
INTA3220.name: Gov't & Politics-Germany
INTA3220.description: Examines the government and politics of Germany with an in-depth focus on the post-1945 period. NOTE: When taught jointly with the School of Modern Languages, all lectures, assignments, and readings are in German.

INTA3221.subject: INTA
INTA3221.name: Post-Soviet Politics
INTA3221.description: Focuses on the challenge of building new social, political, and economic systems in Russia, but also considers some of the special problems confronting the other fourteen post-Soviet states.

INTA3223.subject: INTA
INTA3223.name: Transatlantic Relations
INTA3223.description: Analysis of the different aspects of the relationship between the US and the EU and how it is characterized by cooperation, conflict and competition.

INTA3230.subject: INTA
INTA3230.name: Gov't & Politics-China
INTA3230.description: Investigates the structure and institutions of political power as well as the patterns and features of political change in the contemporary People's Republic of China.

INTA3231.subject: INTA
INTA3231.name: Gov't & Politics-Japan
INTA3231.description: Examines the main institutions, policies, and politics of contemporary Japan. Investigates the impact of social, cultural, and economic forces on Japan's government and politics.

INTA3240.subject: INTA
INTA3240.name: Gov't & Politics-Africa
INTA3240.description: A survey of the history, cultures, social systems, governments, economies, and international roles of Africa. Selected case studies of individual countries are presented.

INTA3241.subject: INTA
INTA3241.name: Latin American Politics
INTA3241.description: Surveys the government and politics of Latin America. The course begins with an overview of the region's geography and history, and then explains why demographic government has had a tenuous existence in this area.

INTA3242.subject: INTA
INTA3242.name: Soccer & Global Politics
INTA3242.description: An examination of regional and national identity, development, and politics through the history of soccer.

INTA3243.subject: INTA
INTA3243.name: US-Latin American Relat
INTA3243.description: Study of government and non-governmental influences on policy and effectiveness of political, economic, and military instruments of power in Latin America.

INTA3260.subject: INTA
INTA3260.name: Middle East Relations
INTA3260.description: Course will provide an in-depth understanding of the Arab-Israeli conflict using theories of international relations and comparative politics.

INTA3301.subject: INTA
INTA3301.name: Int'l Political Econ
INTA3301.description: Analyzes the relationship between political and economic issues in international affairs. Examines the interaction of states and markets in the context of trade, investment, and production.

INTA3303.subject: INTA
INTA3303.name: Pol Economy-Development
INTA3303.description: Surveys theories of economic development and political change, and examines a range of cases that include the European-American experience, the East Asian episode, and the transition from socialism.

INTA3304.subject: INTA
INTA3304.name: Int'l Trade & Production
INTA3304.description: Examines the political economy of international trade and the global production process with particular emphasis on conflict and cooperation in national competition for high- technology industries.

INTA3321.subject: INTA
INTA3321.name: Pol Econ-Europe Integrat
INTA3321.description: Explores the processes and problems of political and economic integration in the European Union, the world's largest trading bloc.

INTA3330.subject: INTA
INTA3330.name: Political Economy-China
INTA3330.description: Examines the centuries of stagnation and the recent rapid growth of the Chinese economy, and seeks to understand the current interaction between politics and economic development in the People's Republic of China.

INTA3331.subject: INTA
INTA3331.name: Political Economy-Japan
INTA3331.description: Surveys the political foundations and economic achievements of modern Japan. Explores the interaction of domestic and international forces, and analyzes Japan's changing world role.

INTA3773.subject: INTA
INTA3773.name: Global Issues&Leadership
INTA3773.description: Invited project based seminar: Uses global issues to explore diverse viewpoints, cultures and cognitive biases to develop leadership and presentation skills in small diverse groups.

INTA3803.subject: INTA
INTA3803.name: Special Topics
INTA3803.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.

INTA3813.subject: INTA
INTA3813.name: Specil Topics
INTA3813.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.

INTA3823.subject: INTA
INTA3823.name: Special Topics
INTA3823.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA3833.subject: INTA
INTA3833.name: Special Topics
INTA3833.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA4007.subject: INTA
INTA4007.name: Intell & Int'l Security
INTA4007.description: This coures examines the history, nature and business of secret intelligence as a critical element of national and international security, with special emphasis given to its role in the global war on terror, and the relationship between the intelligence community and policy makers.

INTA4011.subject: INTA
INTA4011.name: Technology& Military Org
INTA4011.description: Addresses the impact of technological developments on the evolution of military organization and on international conflict from the Battle of Agincourt (1415) to the Gulf War (1991).

INTA4014.subject: INTA
INTA4014.name: Scenario and Pathgaming
INTA4014.description: Introduces students to the construction and presentation of formalized scenarios for international planning, and into the formation, implementation, and assessment of path games. Credit not allowed for both INTA 4014 and INTA 6014.

INTA4016.subject: INTA
INTA4016.name: Strategy & Arms Control
INTA4016.description: Explores elements of military strategy and tactics, weapons proliferation, and arms control efforts.

INTA4040.subject: INTA
INTA4040.name: Environmental Politics
INTA4040.description: Examines the interface between politics and the environment. Foci include sustainable development, the politics of the rain forest, eco-tourism, and export agriculture and the environment.

INTA4050.subject: INTA
INTA4050.name: Int'l Affair&Tech Policy
INTA4050.description: International policy issues in which science and technology figure prominently. Topics include: health, environment, information technologies, arms control and defense, critical infrastructure, transportation, and energy. Emphasis placed on policy analysis and formation.

INTA4060.subject: INTA
INTA4060.name: International Law
INTA4060.description: Explores major issues, concepts and cases in public international law and their policy ramifications. Specific topics include human rights, armed conflict, crimes against humanity, and the environment.

INTA4101.subject: INTA
INTA4101.name: Vietnam War Politics
INTA4101.description: Strategic approaches and political environments of the United States, North Vietnam, China, and the USSR during 1954-1975 Vietnam War.

INTA4121.subject: INTA
INTA4121.name: Sem Europe-Euro Security
INTA4121.description: Examines the history, institutional structure, and functions, as well as current policy challenges facing NATO and other European security arrangements.

INTA4230.subject: INTA
INTA4230.name: Sem in Europe-Euro Union
INTA4230.description: Explores the history and processes of economic and political integration within the framework of the European Union.

INTA4240.subject: INTA
INTA4240.name: Argentine Politics
INTA4240.description: Survey of the politics, history, and culture of Argentina. Topics include Argentine economic and political failure, the politics of immigration, and the relationship between culture and development.

INTA4241.subject: INTA
INTA4241.name: Democracy-Third World
INTA4241.description: Surveys the Third World democratization. Assesses various theories of democratization. Examines various measures of democracy and explores the depth and consolidation of the current democratization boom.

INTA4330.subject: INTA
INTA4330.name: Chinese Economic Reform
INTA4330.description: Addresses the profound and consequential process of the Chinese economic reform that started at the end of the 1970s and has led to China's rapid economic growth.

INTA4331.subject: INTA
INTA4331.name: Chinese Politics
INTA4331.description: Investigates the organizational apparatus through which the Chinese Communist Party exercises leadership over politics and society, and the way in which reforms have changed those relationships.

INTA4332.subject: INTA
INTA4332.name: Chinese Institutions
INTA4332.description: Supervised field research on the Chinese institutions and policy-making process especially in the areas of economic and social issues.

INTA4333.subject: INTA
INTA4333.name: Korean Security Policy
INTA4333.description: An examination of the principal policy issues facing the United States with regard to the Korean Peninsula and the principal neighboring states, China and Japan.

INTA4340.subject: INTA
INTA4340.name: Latin American Economics
INTA4340.description: Examines institutional, interest group, international, and economic inputs and outputs of regional integration.

INTA4500.subject: INTA
INTA4500.name: INTA Pro-Seminar
INTA4500.description: Capstone experience in which students formulate strategies and policies to cope with international problems. Themes vary from seminar to seminar. Credit not allowed for both INTA 4500 and INTA 4400.

INTA4698.subject: INTA
INTA4698.name: Research Assistantship
INTA4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

INTA4699.subject: INTA
INTA4699.name: Undergraduate Research
INTA4699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

INTA4740.subject: INTA
INTA4740.name: Sem-Political Economy
INTA4740.description: Capstone experience in which students apply tools of political economy to international issues. Crosslisted with ECOn 4740.

INTA4741.subject: INTA
INTA4741.name: Thesis-Political Economy
INTA4741.description: Individual project applying the tools of political economy to international issues. Crosslisted with ECON 4741.

INTA4742.subject: INTA
INTA4742.name: Mod, Sim&Military Gaming
INTA4742.description: Creation and use of modeling and simulation tools to analyze and train students regarding strategic events in international relations. Credit not allowed for both INTA 4742 and INTA 6742 (or CSE 6742 or CS 4343).

INTA4743.subject: INTA
INTA4743.name: Japan Society & Politics
INTA4743.description: Surveys key aspects of Japanese society and politics through the use of Japanese language readings, films, and other instructionsal materials. Course taught mostly in Japanese. Crosslisted with JAPN 4743.

INTA4744.subject: INTA
INTA4744.name: Global Develop Capstone
INTA4744.description: Teams develop solutions to multidisciplinary problems selected from globalization, food security, infrastructure, health, water, sanitation, hygiene, ecosystem resilience, services, capacity building, and urbanization.

INTA4803.subject: INTA
INTA4803.name: Special Topics
INTA4803.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.

INTA4811.subject: INTA
INTA4811.name: Special Topics
INTA4811.description: Topics of interest not covered in the regular course offerings.

INTA4812.name: Special Topics
INTA4812.description: Topics of interest not covered in the regular course offerings.

INTA4813.description: Topics of interest not covered in the regular course offerings.

INTA4814.name: Special Topics
INTA4814.description: Topics of interest not covered in the regular course offerings.

INTA4815.subject: INTA
INTA4815.name: Special Topics
INTA4815.description: Topics of interest not covered in the regular course offerings.

INTA4823.name: Special Topics
INTA4823.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.

INTA4833.subject: INTA
INTA4833.name: Special Topics
INTA4833.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.

INTA4901.subject: INTA
INTA4901.name: Special Problems
INTA4901.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA4902.subject: INTA
INTA4902.name: Special Problems
INTA4902.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA4903.subject: INTA
INTA4903.name: Special Problems
INTA4903.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA6002.subject: INTA
INTA6002.name: Strategic Decisions
INTA6002.description: Examines the dynamics of individual, group, organizational, cross-cultural, and international interaction.

INTA6003.subject: INTA
INTA6003.name: Empirical Research Meth
INTA6003.description: This course introduces research methods in international affairs. It emphasizes writing research proposals, empirical techniques, gathering and assembling data, and methods for analyzing and reporting results.

INTA6004.subject: INTA
INTA6004.name: Model,Forecast&Decision
INTA6004.description: This course introduces modeling and forecasting in strategic decision making, analysis of long-term developments, path gaming, formal analysis of games, and simulation.

INTA6011.subject: INTA
INTA6011.name: Intl Trade&Tech Transfer
INTA6011.description: This course examines the relationship between international trade and technology transfer and their effect on national competitiveness, national security, and international cooperation and coercion.

INTA6014.subject: INTA
INTA6014.name: Scenario and Path Gaming
INTA6014.description: Introduces students to the construction and presentation of formalized scenerios for international planning, and into the formulation, implementation and assessment of path games. Credit not allowed for both INTA 6014 and INTA 4014.

INTA6015.subject: INTA
INTA6015.name: Technology& Military Org
INTA6015.description: Explores changes in military technology, organization, and operations leading to new conceptions of the conduct of warfare as a result of revolutions in military affairs.

INTA6016.subject: INTA
INTA6016.name: Strategy & Arms Control
INTA6016.description: Explores elements of military strategy and tactics, weapons proliferation, and arms control efforts.

INTA6022.subject: INTA
INTA6022.name: Ethics & Intl Affairs
INTA6022.description: An overview of the main tradition and theories of international ethics applied to four major issues: intervention and the use of force; human rights; self- determination; and global distributive justice.

INTA6102.subject: INTA
INTA6102.name: Intl Relations Theory
INTA6102.description: This course provides an introduction to theoretical approaches to understanding international relations. The focus of the course is on system-level theories and sub-systematic-level theories.

INTA6103.subject: INTA
INTA6103.name: International Security
INTA6103.description: Examines traditional and nontraditional issues in international security, including the uses of military force, military strategy and policy, arms control, peacekeeping, the environment, and migration.

INTA6105.subject: INTA
INTA6105.name: Intl Institutional Dsgn
INTA6105.description: This course examines international institutions and their effect on foreign policy decision makers. Specific topics include: the theoretical study of cooperation; supranatural organizations and informal institutions.

INTA6106.subject: INTA
INTA6106.name: The State-Intl Affairs
INTA6106.description: Explores various concepts of the state in international affairs as well as the concepts of sovereignty and revolution.

INTA6111.subject: INTA
INTA6111.name: US Foreign Secur Strat
INTA6111.description: This course focuses on the design and implementation of U.S. foreign policy and national strategy in the areas of arms control, the Third World, and economic policy.

INTA6121.subject: INTA
INTA6121.name: Sem in Europe: Euro Sec
INTA6121.description: This course examines the history, institutional structure and functions, and current policy challenges facing the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and other European security institutions.

INTA6131.subject: INTA
INTA6131.name: Pacific Security Issues
INTA6131.description: Examines past, present, and future security concerns in the Pacific, including the Korean pennisula, Japanese defense, the emergence of China as a military power, and the forward basing of American troops and material.

INTA6202.subject: INTA
INTA6202.name: Comparative Politics
INTA6202.description: This course surveys the major political types of the late twentieth century world and explores their various development characteristics.

INTA6203.subject: INTA
INTA6203.name: Compar Institut Design
INTA6203.description: This course examines the creation, maintenance, and evolution of political institutions, and the ways in which institutions affect policy choice.

INTA6302.subject: INTA
INTA6302.name: Intl Political Economy
INTA6302.description: This course is an introduction to the politics of international economic relations. Major theoretical approaches are applied to international trade, international monetary relations, and global production in the modern era.

INTA6304.subject: INTA
INTA6304.name: Modernization&Developmnt
INTA6304.description: This course empirically examines processes in which a country's organizational structure is altered through economic development, political democratization, and/or social liberalization.

INTA6306.subject: INTA
INTA6306.name: Globalization
INTA6306.description: Research seminar exploring theoretical perspectives on globalization and the political and economic issues facing modern states and their citizens in a "borderless" world.

INTA6320.subject: INTA
INTA6320.name: Sem in Europe-Euro Union
INTA6320.description: This course explores the history and processes of economic and political integration within the framework of the European Union.

INTA6330.subject: INTA
INTA6330.name: Pol Econ-East Asia
INTA6330.description: This course explores the politics of economic development in China, Japan, and Korea. Focal issues include: trade patterns, financial institutions, trade-bloc formation, industrial competitiveness, and the status of U.S.-East Asian economic relations.

INTA6331.subject: INTA
INTA6331.name: Chinese Political Econ
INTA6331.description: This course examines the Chinese social and economic development from the seventh century to current day. Specific emphasis is placed on the political economic reforms of Deng Xiaoping and assessing the implications of continued Chinese modernization.

INTA6740.subject: INTA
INTA6740.name: Innovation and the State
INTA6740.description: Research seminar exploring the role of the state in industrial development, innovation and business-government relations. Special attention given to science and technology policies and their influence in different international and industrial contexts. Crosslisted with PUBP 6740.

INTA6742.subject: INTA
INTA6742.name: Mod, Sim&Military Gaming
INTA6742.description: Focuses on the creation and use of modeling and simulation tools to analyze and train students regarding strategic events in international relations. Credit not allowed for both INTA 6742 and CSE 6742 (or INTA 4742 or CS 4343).

INTA6753.subject: INTA
INTA6753.name: Comp Science&Tech Policy
INTA6753.description: Examination of the social, political, and cultural contexts of science and technology, and how they affect the research, development, and regulatory policies of nations. Crosslisted with PUBP 6753.

INTA7000.subject: INTA
INTA7000.name: Master's Thesis
INTA7000.description: Under the direct supervision of one or more faculty members, graduate students will complete an original research design and execute that study.

INTA8000.subject: INTA
INTA8000.name: Sci,Tech&Int'l Affairs I
INTA8000.description: Research course introducing engineers and scientists to issues in science and technology as related to international security policy and development.

INTA8001.subject: INTA
INTA8001.name: Sci,Tech&Intl Affairs II
INTA8001.description: Research course introducing engineers and scientists to issues in science and technology as related to international security policy and development.

INTA8010.subject: INTA
INTA8010.name: IAST Ph.D. Proseminar
INTA8010.description: An overview of resources and practices of doctoral research in International Affairs, Science, and Technology. Meetings will consist of faculty guest lectures and talks from Library personnel and others.

INTA8813.subject: INTA
INTA8813.name: Special Topics
INTA8813.description: Topics of interest in the field of international affairs.

INTA8823.subject: INTA
INTA8823.name: Special Topics
INTA8823.description: Topics of interest in International Affairs.

INTA8833.subject: INTA
INTA8833.name: Special Topics
INTA8833.description: Topics of interest in the field of International Affairs.

INTA8997.subject: INTA
INTA8997.name: Teaching Assistantship
INTA8997.description: For graduate students with a teaching assistantship.

INTA8998.subject: INTA
INTA8998.name: Research Assistantship
INTA8998.description: For graduate students with a research assistantship.

INTN2006.subject: INTN
INTN2006.name: P/T Professional Internship
INTN2006.description: Supervised domestic work experience for freshmen and sophomore interns working 20-29 hours per week in their major field of study for a semester.

INTN2009.subject: INTN
INTN2009.name: P/T Professional Internship
INTN2009.description: Supervised domestic work experience for freshmen and sophomore interns working 30 to 35 hours per week in their major field of study for a semester.

INTN3011.subject: INTN
INTN3011.name: Work Abroad Semester
INTN3011.description: Undergradute interns working outside the United States.

INTN3016.subject: INTN
INTN3016.name: Work Abroad Semester
INTN3016.description: Supervised professional international experience for undergraduate interns working abroad full-time in their major field of study for approximately 50% of a semester.

INTN3019.subject: INTN
INTN3019.name: Work Abroad Semester
INTN3019.description: Supervised professional international experience for undergraduate interns working abroad full-time in their major field of study for approximately 75% of a semester.

INTN4006.subject: INTN
INTN4006.name: P/T Professional Internship
INTN4006.description: Supervised domestic work experience for junior or senior interns working 20-29 hours per week in their major field of study for a semester.

INTN4009.subject: INTN
INTN4009.name: P/T Professional Internship
INTN4009.description: Supervised domestic work experience for junior or senior interns working 30-35 hours per week in their major field of study for a semester.

IPCO3011.subject: IPCO
IPCO3011.name: Int'l Plan Co-op Abroad
IPCO3011.description: International Plan Co-ops working outside the United States.

IPFS3012.subject: IPFS
IPFS3012.name: Int'l Plan-Exchange Prgm
IPFS3012.description: Placeholder course to document Intrenationl Plan students who are studying abroad in participation with an exchange program and in fullfullment of their International Plan requirements.

IPIN3011.subject: IPIN
IPIN3011.name: Int'l Plan Intern Abroad
IPIN3011.description: International Plan interns working outside the United States.

IPSA3012.subject: IPSA
IPSA3012.name: Int'l Plan-Study Abroad
IPSA3012.description: Placeholder course to document International Plan students who are studying abroad in participation with a summer, faculty-led program and in fullfullment of their International Plan requirements.

ISYE2027.subject: ISYE
ISYE2027.name: Probability With Apps
ISYE2027.description: Topics include conditional probability, density and distribution functions from engineering, expectation, conditional expectation, laws of large numbers, central limit theorem, and introduction to Poisson Processes.

ISYE2028.subject: ISYE
ISYE2028.name: Basic Statistical Meth
ISYE2028.description: Point and interval estimation of systems parameters, statistical decision making about differences in system parameters, analysis and modeling of relationships between variables.

ISYE2127.subject: ISYE
ISYE2127.name: Honors Probability
ISYE2127.description: Topics parallel those in ISYE 2027 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not allowed for both ISYE 2127 and 2027.

ISYE2128.subject: ISYE
ISYE2128.name: Honors Statistics
ISYE2128.description: Topics parallel to those in ISYE 2028 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not given for both ISYE 2028 and 2128.

ISYE2698.subject: ISYE
ISYE2698.name: Research Assistantship
ISYE2698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE2699.subject: ISYE
ISYE2699.name: Undergraduate Research
ISYE2699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE2801.subject: ISYE
ISYE2801.name: Special Topics
ISYE2801.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE3025.subject: ISYE
ISYE3025.name: Engineering Economy
ISYE3025.description: Introduction to engineering economic decision making, economic decision criteria, discounted cash flow, replacement and timing decisions, risk, depreciation, and income tax.

ISYE3039.subject: ISYE
ISYE3039.name: Methods-Quality Improve
ISYE3039.description: Topics include quality system requirements, designed experiments, process capability analysis, measurement capability, statistical process control, and acceptance sampling plans. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE 3039 and ISYE 6382.

ISYE3044.subject: ISYE
ISYE3044.name: Simulation Analy & Dsgn
ISYE3044.description: Discrete event simulation methodology emphasizing the statistical basis for simulation modeling and analysis. Overview of computer languages and simulation design applied to various industrial situations.

ISYE3103.subject: ISYE
ISYE3103.name: Sply Chain Mod:Logistics
ISYE3103.description: Course focuses on engineering design concepts and optimization models for logistics decision making in three modules: supply chain design, planning and execution, and transportation.

ISYE3104.subject: ISYE
ISYE3104.name: Sply Chain Mod:Manf&Ware
ISYE3104.description: Design and operation of manufacturing and warehousing facilities.

ISYE3133.subject: ISYE
ISYE3133.name: Engineering Optimization
ISYE3133.description: Topics include modeling with networks and graphs; linear, nonlinear, and integer programming, construction of models employing modern modeling languages; and general solution strategies.

ISYE3232.subject: ISYE
ISYE3232.name: Stochastic Mfg&Serv Sys
ISYE3232.description: Methods for describing stochastic movements of material in manufacturing facilities, supply chain, and equipment maintenance networks. Includes analysis of congestion, delays, and inventory ordering policies.

ISYE3770.subject: ISYE
ISYE3770.name: Statistics& Applications
ISYE3770.description: Introduction to probability, probability distributions, point estimation, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, linear regression, and analysis of variance. Crosslisted with MATH 3770 and CEE 3770. Also, credit not awarded for both ISYE 3770 and MATH 3670.

ISYE3790.subject: ISYE
ISYE3790.name: Intro-Cognitive Science
ISYE3790.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on cognitive science. Interdisciplinary approaches to issues in cognition, including memory, language, problem solving, learning, perception, and action. Crosslisted with CS, PST, and PSYC 3790.

ISYE3833.subject: ISYE
ISYE3833.name: Special Topics
ISYE3833.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE4009.subject: ISYE
ISYE4009.name: Human Integrated Systems
ISYE4009.description: Topics include general cognitive systems engineering concepts and principles, and specific concepts and principles of interface design, task analysis, prototyping, and empirical usability of evaluation methods.

ISYE4031.subject: ISYE
ISYE4031.name: Regression/Forecasting
ISYE4031.description: Regression analysis: multiple linear regression, diagnostics, and variable selection. Forecasting: exponential smoothing techniques and autoregressive moving average models.

ISYE4106.subject: ISYE
ISYE4106.name: Senior Design
ISYE4106.description: Senior design project requiring student to formulate a project plan with an off-campus enterprise. Includes specific milestones, targets, and evaluation criteria.

ISYE4111.subject: ISYE
ISYE4111.name: Adv Supply Chain Logists
ISYE4111.description: This course is a follow-up to ISyE 3103 that covers optimization models and case studies for logistics network design and logistics operations.

ISYE4133.subject: ISYE
ISYE4133.name: Advanced Optimization
ISYE4133.description: Theory and implementation of practical methods to find good or optimal solutions to optimization problems too large or complex to solve in a straightforward way.

ISYE4232.subject: ISYE
ISYE4232.name: Advanced Stochastic Sys
ISYE4232.description: The course will cover Jackson Networks and Markov Decision Processes with applications to production/inventory systems, customer contact centers, revenue management, and health care.

ISYE4301.subject: ISYE
ISYE4301.name: Supply Chain Economics
ISYE4301.description: The course studies techniques for coordination and collaboration in supply chains. Applications include pricing strategies, revenue management, gaming, and incentives.

ISYE4311.subject: ISYE
ISYE4311.name: Capital Invest Analysis
ISYE4311.description: Students learn core concepts and techniques for economic decision and analysis of complex capital investment problems that involve dimensions of time, uncertainty and strategy.

ISYE4331.subject: ISYE
ISYE4331.name: Honors Optimization
ISYE4331.description: Topics parallel those in ISYE 4231 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not given for both ISYE 4331 and 4231.

ISYE4698.subject: ISYE
ISYE4698.name: Research Assistantship
ISYE4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE4699.subject: ISYE
ISYE4699.name: Undergraduate Research
ISYE4699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE4740.subject: ISYE
ISYE4740.name: Bio-Inspired Design
ISYE4740.description: We examine evolutionary adaptation as a course for engineering design inspiration, utilizing principles of scaling, adaptability, and robust multifunctionality that characterize biological systems. Credit not allowed for both ISYE 4740 and (BIOL 4740, or PTFE 4740 or MSE 4740 or ME 4740).

ISYE4801.subject: ISYE
ISYE4801.name: Special Topics
ISYE4801.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE4802.subject: ISYE
ISYE4802.name: Special Topics
ISYE4802.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE4803.subject: ISYE
