PSYC4910.subject: PSYC
PSYC4910.name: Special Problems
PSYC4910.description: Students engage in individual and group projects under the direction of a faculty member.

PSYC6000.subject: PSYC
PSYC6000.name: Resp. Conduct Research
PSYC6000.description: Topics include research misconduct, data management, use of animal and human subjects, conflicts of interest and commitment, authorship, publication, peer review , and collaboration and mentoring.

PSYC6011.subject: PSYC
PSYC6011.name: Cognitive Psychology
PSYC6011.description: Survey course on human cognition including pattern recognition, attention, memory, categorization, problem solving, consciousness, decision making, intention, and the relation between mind and brain.

PSYC6012.subject: PSYC
PSYC6012.name: Social Psychology
PSYC6012.description: Fundamental theory and research in social behavior including social perception/cognition, attitude formation and change, social influences, and group processes.

PSYC6013.subject: PSYC
PSYC6013.name: Biopsychology
PSYC6013.description: Neurophysiological, endocrinological, and biochemical bases of sensory and motor functioning, motivation, learning, memory, and behavior dysfunction.

PSYC6014.subject: PSYC
PSYC6014.name: Sensation & Perception
PSYC6014.description: This course examines how sensations and perceptions of the outside world are processed by humans, including physiological, psychophysical, ecological, and computational perspectives.

PSYC6015.subject: PSYC
PSYC6015.name: Developmental Psychology
PSYC6015.description: Overview of concepts, assumptions, methods, theories, and research in human development across the life span including cognitive, emotional, and social behavior.

PSYC6016.subject: PSYC
PSYC6016.name: Analysis of Behavior
PSYC6016.description: Conceptual, methodological, and theoretical issues in the experimental analysis of behavior with special emphasis on classical and operant conditioning as foundations for complex behavior.

PSYC6017.subject: PSYC
PSYC6017.name: Human Abilities
PSYC6017.description: Theory, methods, and applications of research on human abilities, including intelligence, aptitude, achievement, learning, aptitude treatment interactions, information processing correlates, and measurement issues.

PSYC6018.subject: PSYC
PSYC6018.name: Research Design
PSYC6018.description: Introduction to basic principles and practices of empirical research in psychology. Covers both experimental and correlational methods and designs.

PSYC6019.subject: PSYC
PSYC6019.name: Statistical Analysis I
PSYC6019.description: Introductory treatment of descriptive and inferential statistics as applied to psychological research.

PSYC6020.subject: PSYC
PSYC6020.name: Statistical Analaysis II
PSYC6020.description: Introductory treatment of inferential statistics, especially the general linear model, as applied to psychological research.

PSYC6021.subject: PSYC
PSYC6021.name: Personality Theories
PSYC6021.description: Survey of personality theories, research, and methods of assessment.

PSYC6022.subject: PSYC
PSYC6022.name: Psyc Stat for HCI
PSYC6022.description: Introduction to statistical methods as applied to psychological data within the HCI domain. Credit not allowed for both PSYC 6022 and PSYC 2020.

PSYC6023.subject: PSYC
PSYC6023.name: Psyc Res Methods for HCI
PSYC6023.description: Introduction to psychological research methods within the HCI domain. Credit not allowed for both PSYC 6023 and PSYC 2020.

PSYC6031.subject: PSYC
PSYC6031.name: Eng Psyc Analysis Tech
PSYC6031.description: This course covers the basic analysis techniques used to investigate human-machine systems and human performance.

PSYC6032.subject: PSYC
PSYC6032.name: Eng Psyc Stressors
PSYC6032.description: This course covers environmental stressors and their influence on human performance. Emphasis will be placed onnoise, lighting, micro-gravity and atmospheric conditions.

PSYC6033.subject: PSYC
PSYC6033.name: Eng Psyc Cognitive Ergo
PSYC6033.description: This course applies the research findings from cognitive psychology to the design of products and systems that involve people.

PSYC6034.subject: PSYC
PSYC6034.name: Eng Psyc Displays
PSYC6034.description: This course covers the basic human factors principles involved in display formatting.

PSYC6035.subject: PSYC
PSYC6035.name: Eng Psyc Cntrl&Workspace
PSYC6035.description: This course covers the basic human factors principles involved in controls and workspace layout.

PSYC6040.subject: PSYC
PSYC6040.name: Topics in Cog & Brain Sc
PSYC6040.description: This course presents current research topics in cognition and brain science.

PSYC6041.subject: PSYC
PSYC6041.name: Topics in Cog Aging
PSYC6041.description: This course presents current research topics in cognitive aging.

PSYC6042.subject: PSYC
PSYC6042.name: Neuroimaging
PSYC6042.description: This course details the potential and limits of fMRI and critically evaluates the inferences that can be drawn from fMRI studies.

PSYC6043.subject: PSYC
PSYC6043.name: Engr Psyc Res Seminar
PSYC6043.description: This course presents current research topics in engineering psychology.

PSYC6060.subject: PSYC
PSYC6060.name: Psyc of Aging
PSYC6060.description: A survey covering psychological aspects of aging, mind, and behavior (perception, cognition, emotion, mental health) and topics relevant to adulthood (e.g. caregiving and retirement).

PSYC6090.subject: PSYC
PSYC6090.name: Cognitive Neuroscience
PSYC6090.description: Examines the foundations of Cognitive Neuroscience, including the biological mechanisms underlying cognition, the dominant theories, and the experimental techniques.

PSYC6270.subject: PSYC
PSYC6270.name: Psychological Testing
PSYC6270.description: Fundamentals of psychological testing. Topics include test construction and application issues.

PSYC6750.subject: PSYC
PSYC6750.name: Human-Computer Interact
PSYC6750.description: Describes the characteristics of interaction between humans and computers and demonstrates techniques for the evaluation of user-centered systems. Crosslisted with CS 6750.

PSYC6753.subject: PSYC
PSYC6753.name: HCI Prof Prep & Practice
PSYC6753.description: Preparation for a professional career in HCI. Speakers. Atlanta-area lab visits. Career trajectories. Project presentations. Technical, resume and interviewing skills, Atlanta-area HCI resources. Credit not allowed for both PSYC 6753 and CS 6753 or LCC 6753.

PSYC6795.subject: PSYC
PSYC6795.name: Intro-Cognitive Science
PSYC6795.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on cognitive science. Interdisciplinary approaches to issues in cognition, including memory, language, problem solving, learning, perception, and action. Crosslisted with CS and ISYE 6795.

PSYC6998.subject: PSYC
PSYC6998.name: HCI Master's Project
PSYC6998.description: Final project for students completing a Human-Computer Interaction master's degree. Repeatable for multi-semester projects.

PSYC7020.subject: PSYC
PSYC7020.name: Cognitive Aging
PSYC7020.description: Introduction to theory and research on adult cognitive development, including intelligence, attention, memory, and problem solving.

PSYC7101.subject: PSYC
PSYC7101.name: Engineering Psy I
PSYC7101.description: Basic methods used to study human-machine systems including both system analysis and human performance evaluation techniques. These methods will be applied to specific systems.

PSYC7102.subject: PSYC
PSYC7102.name: Engineering Psy II
PSYC7102.description: Basic principles of human factors for the design, evaluation, and use of displays, controls, and workspace layouts including new technologies and associated human factors problems.

PSYC7103.subject: PSYC
PSYC7103.name: Engineering Psy III
PSYC7103.description: Environmental stressors and their influences on human performance, physiological function, and emotional responses including work/rest cycles, jetlag, noise, vibration, glare, weightlessness, etc.

PSYC7104.subject: PSYC
PSYC7104.name: Psychomotor & Cog Skill
PSYC7104.description: Human capabilities and limitations for learning and performing psychomotor and cognitive skills are studied.

PSYC7105.subject: PSYC
PSYC7105.name: First Yr Research I
PSYC7105.description: First year graduate students will initiate a research project.

PSYC7106.subject: PSYC
PSYC7106.name: First Yr Research II
PSYC7106.description: First year graduate students will complete a research project.

PSYC7201.subject: PSYC
PSYC7201.name: Industrial/Organiz Psy
PSYC7201.description: This course introduces an overview of issues relevant to behavior in the workplace and psychology applied in industrial and organizational settings.

PSYC7202.subject: PSYC
PSYC7202.name: Employee Selection
PSYC7202.description: The course provides a conceptual framework for personnel selection guided by scientific principles, research, and theory as well as by professional, legal, and technical guidelines.

PSYC7203.subject: PSYC
PSYC7203.name: Motivation&Job Attitudes
PSYC7203.description: Examines theory and pragmatics in description, prediction, and measurement of work-related behavior and associated evaluations. Includes theoretical and methodological problems in field and laboratory contexts.

PSYC7204.subject: PSYC
PSYC7204.name: Training & Development
PSYC7204.description: This course will focus on theory, principles, techniques, and practices relevant to training and developing human resources. Research and professional literature will be examined.

PSYC7301.subject: PSYC
PSYC7301.name: Multivariate Statistics
PSYC7301.description: Foundations for multivariate analysis including properties of linear composite variables, multiple regression, multiple and partial correlation, MANOVA, factor analysis, multiple discriminant analysis, canonical correlation, etc.

PSYC7302.subject: PSYC
PSYC7302.name: Equation Modeling
PSYC7302.description: Methods of causal modeling to study causal relations including issues of causality, establishing causality, fundamentals of linear structural equation modeling with latent variables, fitting models.

PSYC7303.subject: PSYC
PSYC7303.name: Psychometric Theory
PSYC7303.description: Preparation of students in statistical theory and techniques relevant to becoming professionally involved in construction, analysis, and evaluation of psychology and personnel tests.

PSYC7700.subject: PSYC
PSYC7700.name: Professional Problems
PSYC7700.description: Discussion of issues faced by professional psychologists in the areas of teaching, research, and professional practice. Ethical issues in all of these areas are emphasized.

PSYC7701.subject: PSYC
PSYC7701.name: Teaching Practicum
PSYC7701.description: Supervised college teaching including techniques, course and curriculum design, evaluation. Students will prepare and present lectures with direct observations and video taping for discussion.

PSYC7790.subject: PSYC
PSYC7790.name: Cognitive Modeling
PSYC7790.description: A hands-on course covering a range of cognitive modeling methodologies. It explores the analysis, development, construction, and evaluation of models of cognitive processing. Crosslisted with CS and ISYE 7790.

PSYC8000.subject: PSYC
PSYC8000.name: Sem-Experimental Psy
PSYC8000.description: Critical examination of current problems in a selected area of general experimental psychology. Areas to be discussed may vary each time course is offered.

PSYC8010.subject: PSYC
PSYC8010.name: Seminar-Cognitive Psy
PSYC8010.description: Critical examination of current problems in a selected area of cognitive psychology. Areas to be discussed may vary each time course is offered.

PSYC8020.subject: PSYC
PSYC8020.name: Seminar-Cognitive Aging
PSYC8020.description: Critical examination of current problems in a selected area of cognitive aging. Areas to be discussed may vary each time course is offered.

PSYC8030.subject: PSYC
PSYC8030.name: Sem-Comparative Psy
PSYC8030.description: Critical examination of current problems in a selected area of comparative psychology. Areas to be discussed may vary each time course is offered.

PSYC8040.subject: PSYC
PSYC8040.name: Seminar-Engineering Psy
PSYC8040.description: Critical examination of current problems in a selected area of engineering psychology. Areas to be discussed may vary each time course is offered.

PSYC8050.subject: PSYC
PSYC8050.name: Sem-Indust/Organiz Psy
PSYC8050.description: Critical examination of current problems in a selected area of industrial/organizational psychology. Areas to be discussed may vary each time course is offered.

PSYC8060.subject: PSYC
PSYC8060.name: Sem-Quantitative Psy
PSYC8060.description: Presentation and discussion of quantitative approaches to psychology. Topics will vary, but might include neural networks, measurement theory, behavioral ecology, modeling, system dynamics, etc.

PSYC8070.subject: PSYC
PSYC8070.name: Seminar CogNeuro
PSYC8070.description: Critical examination of current problems in selected areas of cognitive neuroscience. Areas to be discussed vary each time.

PSYC8080.subject: PSYC
PSYC8080.name: Seminar Cog & Brain
PSYC8080.description: Critical examination of current problems in selected areas of cognition and brain sciences. Areas to be discussed may vary each time.

PSYC8795.subject: PSYC
PSYC8795.name: Colloquium-Cognitive Sci
PSYC8795.description: Reading of research papers by leading cognitive scientists, attendance at their colloquia, and meeting with them to discuss research. Crosslisted with CS and ISYE 8795.

PSYC8802.subject: PSYC
PSYC8802.name: Topics in CogNeuro
PSYC8802.description: Covers current issues and recent advances in cognitive neuroscience.

PSYC8803.subject: PSYC
PSYC8803.name: Spec Top-Applied Stat
PSYC8803.description: Covers current issues and recent advances in the application of statistical methods to research in psychology. Instructors select the specific focus for a given term.

PSYC8804.subject: PSYC
PSYC8804.name: Topics in Cog Aging
PSYC8804.description: Covers current issues and recent advances in cognitive aging.

PSYC8805.subject: PSYC
PSYC8805.name: Topics in CogNeuro
PSYC8805.description: Covers current issues and recent advances in cognitive neuroscience.

PSYC8806.subject: PSYC
PSYC8806.name: Topics in Cog Psyc
PSYC8806.description: Covers current issues and recent advances in cognitive psychology.

PSYC8807.subject: PSYC
PSYC8807.name: Special Topics Engr Psyc
PSYC8807.description: Covers current issues and recent advances in Engineering Psychology

PSYC8811.subject: PSYC
PSYC8811.name: Special Topics
PSYC8811.description: Special topics that cover current issues and recent advances in Psychology.

PSYC8812.subject: PSYC
PSYC8812.name: Special Topics
PSYC8812.description: Special topics that cover current issues and recent advances in Psychology.

PSYC8900.subject: PSYC
PSYC8900.name: Spec Prob-Experiment Psy
PSYC8900.description: Students conduct research under direction of a faculty member on problems in the general area of experimental psychology.

PSYC8901.subject: PSYC
PSYC8901.name: Spec Prob-Engr Psy
PSYC8901.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in the general area of engineering psychology.

PSYC8902.subject: PSYC
PSYC8902.name: Spe Prob-Ind/Organiz Psy
PSYC8902.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems investigating some psychological aspect of industrial/organizational problems.

PSYC8903.subject: PSYC
PSYC8903.name: Special Problems in HCI
PSYC8903.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in the general area of human-computer interaction.

PSYC8904.subject: PSYC
PSYC8904.name: Spec Problems: Cog Aging
PSYC8904.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in cognitive aging.

PSYC8905.subject: PSYC
PSYC8905.name: Special Prblems: CogNeuro
PSYC8905.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in cognitive neuroscience.

PSYC8906.subject: PSYC
PSYC8906.name: Special Problems: CogPsyc
PSYC8906.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in cognitive psychology.

PSYC8907.subject: PSYC
PSYC8907.name: Spec Problems: Cog&Brain
PSYC8907.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in cognition and brain sciences.

PSYC8908.subject: PSYC
PSYC8908.name: Spec Problems: Quant Psyc
PSYC8908.description: Students conduct research under the direction of a faculty member on problems in quantitative psychology.

PSYC8997.subject: PSYC
PSYC8997.name: Teaching Assistantship
PSYC8997.description: For graduate students holding a teaching assistantship.

PSYC8998.subject: PSYC
PSYC8998.name: Research Assistantship
PSYC8998.description: For graduate students holding a research assistantship.

PTFE1100.subject: PTFE
PTFE1100.name: Intro-Polymer&Fiber Engr
PTFE1100.description: Introduction to and overview of the breadth and depth of the polymer, fiber, textile, and fabricated products manufacturing complex, its infrastructure, resources, opportunities, and career paths.

PTFE2200.subject: PTFE
PTFE2200.name: Struct&Prop-Fibers&Polym
PTFE2200.description: The micro and macro structure of fibers are examined. Structure property relationships will be covered, and various properties of both natural and synthetic fibers will be discussed.

PTFE2698.subject: PTFE
PTFE2698.name: Research Assistantship
PTFE2698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

PTFE2699.subject: PTFE
PTFE2699.name: Undergraduate Research
PTFE2699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

PTFE3200.subject: PTFE
PTFE3200.name: Yarn & Fabric Formation
PTFE3200.description: Principles of yarn formation, weaving preparation and weaving, modern processing technologies, and product structure-property relationship.

PTFE3210.subject: PTFE
PTFE3210.name: Transport-Polymers&Fiber
PTFE3210.description: An introduction to heat and mass transfer, psychrometrics, and flow through porous media, emphasizing applications to polymers, fibers, and textiles. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 3210 and MSE 3210.

PTFE3220.subject: PTFE
PTFE3220.name: Text Operations&Mgt Meth
PTFE3220.description: Principles and applications of production and operations management to the textile enterprise, including process flow analysis, production planning and scheduling, optimization, quality management, and facilities planning. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 3220 and MSE 3220.

PTFE3221.subject: PTFE
PTFE3221.name: Textile Formation&Test
PTFE3221.description: Plant layout and processing equipment for yarn and fabric formation. Laboratory testing on yarns, fabrics, and carpet. Data analysis.

PTFE3230.subject: PTFE
PTFE3230.name: Polymer&Fiber Processing
PTFE3230.description: Discussion of the principles of fiber formation from polymers including rheology, mechanics, energetics, phase transition, and polymer structure. High-performance fiber processing, and plastics processing. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 3230 and MSE 3230.

PTFE3720.subject: PTFE
PTFE3720.name: Intro-Fiber Enterprise
PTFE3720.description: This course approaches the manufacture of engineered fibrous structures from a manager's viewpoint. The student will receive a working knowledge and understanding of the various processes in manufacturing fibers and fibrous structures from yarns to fiber optics for telecommunications. Guest lectures from industry representatives and plant trips will enhance understanding. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 3720 and MSE 3720.

PTFE4020.subject: PTFE
PTFE4020.name: Textile Mgt Internship
PTFE4020.description: Students will participate in an internship at an industrial site where they will receive management training and be involved with corporate activities such as sales, marketing, management, and human resources.

PTFE4043.subject: PTFE
PTFE4043.name: Safety and Ethics
PTFE4043.description: Principles of ethics and safety are presented. The legal requirements for chemical usage and worker safety are discussed.

PTFE4100.subject: PTFE
PTFE4100.name: Chem Proc-Text Materials
PTFE4100.description: The chemical, thermal, and mechanical processes used in the preparation, coloration, and finishing of textile surfaces. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4100 and MSE 4100.

PTFE4101.subject: PTFE
PTFE4101.name: Carpet Technology
PTFE4101.description: A study of materials and production systems used in carpet manufacturing. Carpet structures and performance characteristics, and industry structure and markets are examined.

PTFE4102.subject: PTFE
PTFE4102.name: Nonwovens Technology
PTFE4102.description: A review of the principles of nonwoven processes. Review of the machinery requirements for the most commonly produced structures is followed by an analysis of the structure-property relationships of nonwoven fabrics.

PTFE4103.subject: PTFE
PTFE4103.name: Knitting Technology
PTFE4103.description: An overview of warp and weft knitting processes. Review of the machinery requirements and analysis of structure-property relationships of knit fabrics.

PTFE4104.subject: PTFE
PTFE4104.name: Industrial Textiles
PTFE4104.description: Design, structures, properties, and processes of textiles for industrial applications.

PTFE4105.subject: PTFE
PTFE4105.name: Survey-Apparel Industry
PTFE4105.description: Study of processes in manufacturing of apparel including sourcing options available nationally and internationally. Includes the analysis of the stages of production, marketing, and distribution.

PTFE4106.subject: PTFE
PTFE4106.name: Science of Color
PTFE4106.description: The physical, chemical, and biological principles involved in the perception, measurement, and specification of color and its applications.

PTFE4107.subject: PTFE
PTFE4107.name: App of Mech-Text Struct
PTFE4107.description: Applications of mechanics of yarns, fabrics, and other flexible bodies, including yarn and fabric geometry; response to tensile and bending deformations, and fabric shear and drape.

PTFE4108.subject: PTFE
PTFE4108.name: Tex Production Economics
PTFE4108.description: A PTFE elective course designed to explore the factor costs of production across seven countries within the context of industry globalization drivers.

PTFE4110.subject: PTFE
PTFE4110.name: Poly&Fiber Engr Design I
PTFE4110.description: A design course covering the principles of concurrent product/process design and development. Team-based projects will explore product/process design and development in the polymers, fibers, and areas of polymers and textiles. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4110 and MSE 4410.

PTFE4122.subject: PTFE
PTFE4122.name: Textile Chemistry Lab
PTFE4122.description: Laboratory course in preparation, colorization, and finishing of textiles. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4122 and MSE 4122.

PTFE4140.subject: PTFE
PTFE4140.name: Poly Solutions&Surfaces
PTFE4140.description: Physical chemistry of polymer solutions, polymer miscibility, adsorptions, sorptions, plasticization, molecular weights, molecular weight distributions. Study of polymer surfaces. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4140 and MSE 4140.

PTFE4141.subject: PTFE
PTFE4141.name: Polymer Characterization
PTFE4141.description: Polymer characterization using thermomechanical, scattering, and microscopy, as well as spectroscopy techniques.

PTFE4210.subject: PTFE
PTFE4210.name: Poly&Fiber Eng Design II
PTFE4210.description: A team problem-solving approach is used to work on a project developed in cooperation with a textile company. Weekly communications, both oral and written, are required. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4201 and MSE 4420.

PTFE4698.subject: PTFE
PTFE4698.name: Research Assistantship
PTFE4698.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

PTFE4699.subject: PTFE
PTFE4699.name: Undergraduate Research
PTFE4699.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

PTFE4720.subject: PTFE
PTFE4720.name: Fiber Proc for Managers
PTFE4720.description: Fundamental understanding of the processing of fibers into engineered structures such as yarns and fabrics (woven, knitted, tufted, and nonwoven). Medical products to spacesuits will be discussed.

PTFE4721.subject: PTFE
PTFE4721.name: Fabric-Color&Performance
PTFE4721.description: Aesthetic and/or physical properties of engineered fibrous structures are changed dramatically by chemical treatments including coloration. The student will receive a basic understanding of the various processes that provide fabrics a silky feel to dazzling colors.

PTFE4723.subject: PTFE
PTFE4723.name: Prop-Textile Material
PTFE4723.description: Mechanics of yarns, fabrics, and other flexible bodies, including yarn and fabric geometry, response to tensile and bending deformations, and fabric shear and drape.

PTFE4740.subject: PTFE
PTFE4740.name: Bio-Inspired Design
PTFE4740.description: We examine evolutionary adaptation as a course for engineering design inspiration, utilizing principles of scaling, adaptability, and robust multifunctionality that characterize biological systems. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4740 and (BIOL 4740 or ISYE 4740 or MSE 4740 or ME 4740).

PTFE4761.subject: PTFE
PTFE4761.name: Industrial Ctrls & Mfg
PTFE4761.description: Students are introduced to industrial controls and the fundamentals of manufacturing with hands-on experience based on lab projects using industry software and hardware for communications and control. Crosslisted with ECE 4761. Credit not allowed for both PTFE 4761 and MSE 4761.

PTFE4775.subject: PTFE
PTFE4775.name: Polymer Science & Engr I
PTFE4775.description: An introduction to the chemistry, structure, and formation of polymers, physical states and transitions, physical and mechanical properties of polymer fluids and solids. Crosslisted with CHE, CHEM, ME, and MSE 4775.

PTFE4776.subject: PTFE
PTFE4776.name: Polymer Science & Engr II
PTFE4776.description: Polymer fabrication processes and methods of characterization and identification of polymers are presented. Experiments in polymerization, processing, and property evaluation of polymers. Crosslisted with CHE, CHEM, ME, and MSE 4776.

PTFE4777.subject: PTFE
PTFE4777.name: Intro-Polymer Sci & Engr
PTFE4777.description: An introduction to the structure and formation of polymers, physical states and transitions, physical and mechanical properties of polymer fluids and solids, and processing of polymers. Crosslisted with MSE and ME 4777.

PTFE4791.subject: PTFE
PTFE4791.name: Mech Behavior-Composites
PTFE4791.description: Stress-strain behavior of composites, property of matrix and reinforcing materials, mechanics of fiber-reinforced composites, lamina and laminate analysis, and mechanical performance. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, CHE, ME, and MSE 4791.

PTFE4793.subject: PTFE
PTFE4793.name: Composite Mater& Process
PTFE4793.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, CHE, ME, and MSE 4793.

PTFE4794.subject: PTFE
PTFE4794.name: Composite Materials& Mfg
PTFE4794.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, CHE, ME, and MSE 4794.

PTFE4801.subject: PTFE
PTFE4801.name: Special Topics
PTFE4801.description: Topics of special interest in polymers, fibers, and textiles not included in the regular offerings.

PTFE4802.subject: PTFE
PTFE4802.name: Special Topics
PTFE4802.description: Topic of current interest in polyumers, fibers, and textiles not included in the regular offerings.

PTFE4803.subject: PTFE
PTFE4803.name: Special Topics
PTFE4803.description: Topics of current interest in polymers, fibers, and textiles not included in the regular offerings.

PTFE4804.subject: PTFE
PTFE4804.name: Special Topics
PTFE4804.description: Topics of current interest in polymer, fiber, and textiles not included in the regular offerings.

PTFE4901.subject: PTFE
PTFE4901.name: Special Problems
PTFE4901.description: Special problems involving analytical and/or experimental investigations in the fields of polymers, fibers, and textiles.

PTFE4902.subject: PTFE
PTFE4902.name: Special Problems
PTFE4902.description: Special problems involving analytical and/or experimental investigations in the fields of polymers, fibers, and textiles.

PTFE4903.subject: PTFE
PTFE4903.name: Special Problems
PTFE4903.description: Special problems involving analytical and/or experimental investigations in the fields of polymers, fibers, and textiles.

PTFE6100.subject: PTFE
PTFE6100.name: Mech-Fibrous Materials
PTFE6100.description: Discussion of deformation of anisotropic fibrous materials; anisotropy and critical phenomena in the mechanical behavior of fibrous materials; models for viscoelastic behavior of fibrous materials.

PTFE6101.subject: PTFE
PTFE6101.name: Dynamic-Text Dry Process
PTFE6101.description: Features of modern weaving, weaving preparatory, and spinning equipment, and their interaction with fibrous materials are discussed at length.

PTFE6200.subject: PTFE
PTFE6200.name: Industrial Chem Process
PTFE6200.description: The industrial chemical processes for the production of chemicals, monomers, and textile auxiliaries are covered. Chemical textile auxiliaries are discussed in relation to theory and applications.

PTFE6201.subject: PTFE
PTFE6201.name: Dye Synthesis
PTFE6201.description: The chemistry of the synthesis and structures of dyes is covered. Color of dyes is discussed in relation to structure and molecular orbital theory.

PTFE6202.subject: PTFE
PTFE6202.name: Phys Chem-Polym Sorption
PTFE6202.description: Detailed description of sorption by polymers, emphasizing physio-chemical laws of transport of chromophores through solution, interfaces, and solid-state.

PTFE6301.subject: PTFE
PTFE6301.name: Natural Polymers
PTFE6301.description: The structures and properties of natural products are presented. Production of cellulose and proteins is discussed.

PTFE6751.subject: PTFE
PTFE6751.name: Phys Chem-Poly Solutions
PTFE6751.description: Study of polymer solutions, polymer miscibility, adsorptions, sorptions, plasticization, molecular weights, molecular weight distributions, and interfacial phenomena using thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Crosslisted with CHE, CHEM, and MSE 6751.

PTFE6752.subject: PTFE
PTFE6752.name: Polymer Characterization
PTFE6752.description: This course introduces the student to surface, near-surface, and structural methods of polymer characterization. Specialized techniques critical to physical structure are emphasized. Crosslisted with CHE, CHEM, and MSE 6752.

PTFE6755.subject: PTFE
PTFE6755.name: Theoretical Chem-Polymer
PTFE6755.description: Thermodynamics and microscopic dynamics of polymers. Fundamental concepts, including scaling concepts, governing anisotropy of polarizability, phase transitions, morphology, time-dependent correlations, etc. are discussed. Crosslisted with CHEM and MSE 6755.

PTFE6759.subject: PTFE
PTFE6759.name: Mate-Envir Conscious Dgn
PTFE6759.description: Covers the environmental impact of materials choices and quantitative measure of life-cycle assessment and environmental burden. The Natural Step philosophy will be used as a model for the overall approach. Crosslisted with ME and MSE 6759.

PTFE6768.subject: PTFE
PTFE6768.name: Polymer Structure& Props
PTFE6768.description: Formulations and analysis of molecular and phenomenological models of elastic and viscoelastic behavior, development and description of structure, and fundamental aspects of structure-property relations. Crosslisted with MSE, CHE, and ME 6768.

PTFE6778.subject: PTFE
PTFE6778.name: Intro to Biomaterials
PTFE6778.description: Introduction to a variety of biomaterials and their biomedical applications. Crosslisted with CHE and BMED 6778.

PTFE6795.subject: PTFE
PTFE6795.name: Math,Stat&Comp Tech-Mate
PTFE6795.description: Emphasizes the fundamental physical, analytical, and mathematical techniques commonly encountered in materials engineering including stress and strain, crystallographic and orientation transformations, X-ray, TEM, and solid-state concepts. Crosslisted with MSE and ME 6795.

PTFE6796.subject: PTFE
PTFE6796.name: Struct-Property Relation
PTFE6796.description: Introduction to the multi-scale structure effects on material properties. For MSE students, the course will prepare students for future in-depth courses. For non-MSE, students the course will provide a background in materials and may serve as part of the program of study for a minor in materials. Crosslisted with ME and MSE 6796.

PTFE6797.subject: PTFE
PTFE6797.name: Therm&Kinetic Microstruc
PTFE6797.description: The reduction of chemical free energy, strain energy, and interfacial energy control the kinetics of diffusional transformations. These factors are explored from the point of view of processing and stability of the microstructure during service. Crosslisted with MSE and ME 6797.

PTFE6998.subject: PTFE
PTFE6998.name: Safety and Ethics
PTFE6998.description: Principles of ethics and safety are presented. The legal requirements for chemical usage and worker safety are discussed.

PTFE6999.subject: PTFE
PTFE6999.name: TFE Colloquium
PTFE6999.description: Graduate students discuss their research work and special topics in a structured setting with their research groups and research advisors.

PTFE7100.subject: PTFE
PTFE7100.name: Adv Fiber Format&Struct
PTFE7100.description: Principles and theories of structure, properties, and formation of fibers; structural models, physical properties, rheology, mechanics, energetics, and phase transitions in fiber formation processes.

PTFE7771.subject: PTFE
PTFE7771.name: Mech-Polymer Solid&Fluid
PTFE7771.description: Continuum of solids and fluids; mechanics of deformation of anisotropic polymers; yield, breaking, and fatigue; non-Newtonian viscous and viscoelastic behavior of polymer fluids. Crosslisted with CHE, ME, and MSE 7771.

PTFE7791.subject: PTFE
PTFE7791.name: Damage & Fail-Composites
PTFE7791.description: Provides knowledge of the fundamental concepts and methods related to analysis and assessment of damage, failure, and durability of composite material. Crosslisted with AE, CHE, CEE, ME, and MSE 7791.

PTFE7792.subject: PTFE
PTFE7792.name: Mechanics of Composites
PTFE7792.description: Anisotropic elasticity, failure theories, hygrothermal behavior, 3-D analysis of laminates, thick laminates, free- edge effects, stress concentrations, joints, creep and fracture of composites, and advanced topics. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, CHE, ME, and MSE 7792.

PTFE7793.subject: PTFE
PTFE7793.name: Manufacture-Composites
PTFE7793.description: Major manufacturing techniques of metal-, ceramic-, and polymer-matrix composites. Modeling of processes with emphasis on fundamental mechanisms and effects. Crosslisted with AE, CEE, CHE, ME, and MSE 7793.

PTFE8001.subject: PTFE
PTFE8001.name: TFE Seminar
PTFE8001.description: Graduate students discuss their research work. Invited speakers with diverse backgrounds describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

PTFE8002.subject: PTFE
PTFE8002.name: TFE Seminar
PTFE8002.description: Graduate students discuss their research work. Invited speakers with diverse backgrounds describe their experiences, entrepreneurial ventures, and research challenges.

PTFE8801.name: Special Topics
PTFE8801.description: Graduate-level special topic offerings of current interest in polymers, fibers, and textiles, not included in regular courses.

PTFE8802.description: Graduate-level special topic offerings of current interest in polymers, fibers and textiles, not included in regular courses.

PTFE8803.description: Graduate-level special topic offerings of current interest in polymers, fibers and textiles not included in regular courses.

PTFE8813.description: Graduate-level special topic offerings of current interest in polymers, fibers, and textiles not included in regular courses.

PTFE8814.description: Graduate-level special topic offerings of current interest in polymers, fibers, and textiles not included in regular courses.

PTFE8900.name: Special Problems
PTFE8900.description: Graduate-level special problems involving research investigations in the fields of polymers, fibers, and/or textiles.
